review: Excellent customer service! It was my cousin's first time at CPK, let alone Hollywood & Highland! The wait staff was very attentive and gave us a free appetizer!  The waiter also gave us tips on how to make the most of our meal! So great. Thanks CPK!

This rating is based on the service we experienced. Late last month, myself and a party we're waiting for a table during the late afternoon and was told by the hostess that the wait would be about 20 minutes. So we outside with the other parties that were also waiting to be seated. After 15 minutes, we checked to see how far on the list we would be seated with the second hostess. We then noticed some guy go over the fence into the outside patio, waved his friends over to sit at an empty table, and then sat down. Rather than the hostess asking them to leave and wait like the everyone else, he brought their menus and had a waiter come to take their order. Several of us were upset that he allowed this to happen. One of my friends then went inside to see if they were that busy as both hostesses claimed. He said there were eight empty (cleaned and set) tables inside. When he came back out, he told the first hostess (the one that put us on the waitlist) about it and she said we still had to wait. Mind you within 20 minutes we were waiting, only two parties were seated and several more still waiting. This restaurant clearly has poor communication with its staff and needs improvement in order to provide better service for their customers.

Update: I've changed this to one star because I have since had a reaction to that pizza, so it was contaminated with gluten somehow. Luckily I don't have a life-threatening allergy, but for anyone who does, avoid this place. -- Got the gluten-free Margherita pizza to-go. Crust was burnt. Cheese was tasteless. Barely any tomatoes, about 5 small pieces on the entire pizza. Giving this two stars instead of one only because the employees were courteous and accommodating with my allergy and the basil on the pizza was the right amount. I'm not one to leave bad reviews because I'm not very picky but overall the pizza was bad and horribly overpriced ($20!!) Definitely not coming back to this location.

A hit or a miss. The food is good but the service can either be good or terrible.  FOOD: The pizzas are generally good and can be shared between 2 people. My favorite is the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza.  Their salads are good as well.  MUST TRY: Definitely get the sangria flight! You get three different kinds of sangria with fruit. Sooo good!  It is something I order every time I'm there.  SERVICE: This location is in Hollywood. So there is usually a flow of customers. But even after being seated by the hostess, it was so hard to get the server's attention to even order. During some visits, the servers don't come so I have to ask the hostess to get our server. In the end, the hostess just took our order and served us instead. (Thanks girl, you da VIP) Tips: Parking is usually validated ($2.00 for 2 hours) BUT IF YOU PARK AFTER 10PM, YOU HAVE TO PAY A FLAT RATE OF $15.00! This is even if you came a few minutes before 10pm, apparently (i.e. 9:55pm). So keep this in mind.
Always good and consistent! With ppl that work there i can say they are not the smartest but the food comes out pretty fast so I'm ok with it i guess everything is good

300! I've been holding off on my 300th review for something extraordinary.  THIS was simply AMAZING. My family and I were heading over to see Janet in concert (Miss Jackson if ya nasty) at the Hollywood bowl. We left ourselves ample time to eat here and walk over to the bowl, which was about 2 hours and some change. We waited 30 mins for a table. We get in, order, and pay the check immediately so we wouldn't have to wait at the end, and we could just head to the concert fast. We ordered drinks (there were only 3 of us) and waited. Drinks come. We start noticing though that people around us are being sat... and are eating, but our food has yet to make an entrance. This is after like 30 mins of waiting. We ask our waitresses what's going on with our order, and she goes to "check". We wait... from my brothers vantage point, he can see her in the kitchen, so of course i turn around to look.  She's arguing with the chef. Someone lost the order ticket. NO FOOD WAS COMING! Omfg!  We asked to see a manager. Now we legit have to sit though a 2 hour concert STARVING. We can't even believe it, but think for sure the manager is going to fix things. Here he comes... with a bill! "Sorry guys. Sometimes things like this happen." Then he hands my boyfriend a bill... "what's THIS?" "Oh sorry ya, your drinks weren't added to the bill you pre paid. I refunded it, but not the drinks". ARE. YOU. FUCKING. SERIOUS? I've never experienced this in all my life. Lol... you would think with such a HUGE fuck up, they'd offer a gift card? Drinks on the house?  Something?  Nah... and YES the waitress knew we were going to the concert. Never eat here. Horrible NON SERVICE.

We went to order take out for the first time on our way home from Runyon.  We figured we order something healthy since we just got back from our hike.  I ordered the banh mi power bowl and my fiancé ordered the Santa Fe power bowl.  We were looking forward to enjoy our lunch since we were super hungry.  When we opened the box, we were disappointed to see 5 whimpy pieces of chicken.  $14.99 is not a lot of money but it is over priced for the quality that you get.  I should've made my own salad at home instead.  Never again.

I've been eating a lot of CPK and they have changed from years ago. Came here for a dinner after walking around and being a tourist around Hollywood.  They give you bread and the dipping sauce is so tasty. For appetizers we ordered two which was avocado with chips and avocado deep fried rolls. I've been on a binge on eating lots of avocado. It's pretty tasty but the portion size for the avocado and chips is really small. Ordered a Thai pizza and a salad. There are plenty of options for pizza and salad. They are popular for pizza so I would suggest order a pizza.  It is a lot of carbs so I would say if you aren't a diet than this place is pretty alright.  Tip: Sign up for CPK rewards program online to get points for every time you dine, just tell your server your email address or phone number and they can put it in the system.
Had to wait awhile for a table, well worth the wait.  Friendly service, great food.  Love their lemon drop martinis.  Steak cooked to perfection.  Recommend the Waldorf salad

Came here after a long absence.  The last time I was at this specific location was like 10 years ago.  And being at a CPK in general was probably a year.  I ordered the half soup of split pea and barely and potato chowder.  Plus we ordered the shishito peppers which were yum and also a protein bowl which was good.  Loved everything.  It tasted like we remembered it so it's nice locations are consistent.  Sometimes a non fancy meal is what you need.  Also enjoyed the free bread and the sauce it came with.  No line when we arrived, but it was packed and the A/C is strong so bring a jacket even though it is summer.  It was pretty cold inside.  Service was friendly and nice.  This is a big location with tons of indoor and outdoor seating.

A great CPK location in Hollywood. I will say I hardly come here, not a fan of Hollywood, but we came on a Saturday night around 9 and got sat right away.  Decided to try something new and got the banh mi bowl, which was quinoa, baby kale, grilled chicken, watermelon radishes, fresh avocado, cucumbers, and a few other items.   It was pretty tasty, as was their bread.  Sadly they do oil now and not the butter, but the bread is still good.

Let me start off by saying... I have been to CPKs before and I have had a much better experience than what we had last night.  It was slow for a Sunday night and basically everything else around was already closed. We got out of seeing A Goofy Movie at El Cap and wanted some dinner. We walked across the street and found CPK. The hostess stand out front was empty but had a sign telling us to "See Hostess for Seating". In my mind that is telling me to go inside the restaurant and find the hostess or anyone to find a table. The three of us walk in and IMMEDIATELY the hostess comes around the corner to accost us. She tells us that we were supposed to be waiting outside and the sign told us so. I told her no the sign told us to see the hostess so I came to find you. She was very rude and just pointed to a table and gave us some menus and had us sit there. She didn't even walk us to the table. I wish I had gotten her name because I wanted to make sure someone knew about it with every last detail but after that she was no where to be seen for the rest of the night.  Our waitress was friendly and took our drink order right away and when we ordered food the food came out quick. The place was very slow compared to all the hustle and bustle outside on the street at Hollywood blvd. The food was okay just as it always is. I think at the later hour that it was we just wanted something to eat rather than fight the crowds down on the sidewalks to find something better to eat. It was also weird to me that we were eating at 9:30 at night and a lot of restaurants closed at 10pm even in one of the busiest parts of LA. I will have to say though that experience makes to not have great feelings about returning to a CPK, rude staff, bland pizza, and a menu that I haven't seen changes in a long time. Also there was no bread given. The last CPK I went to in Honolulu gave us bread before our meal.

Service was great. There is a lot of parking but make sure you validate your ticket. I was there for about 3 hours and I had to pay $5 with validation. I tried the shrimp Scampi pasta because it was listed under favorites... it was not good! Lol I was with two other people and they tried it and agreed. It had absolutely no flavor and the portion was small. That plate is not worth $15.99 and it's not worth being under the favorites on the menu. We also got the Carne Adada pizza. This is a new pizza and it was surprisingly good. I tried all the lemonades they have ( they are refillable) my favorite one was the Peach flavor

Update of my review::: After posting about my past experience at this location, the manager was extra nice and reached out to help resolve the issue. I've never seen a restaurant be so concerned about a customer who had a bad experience at their place. It really did surprise me. I would definitely come to this location again because of the excellent effort their staff has shown me. Thank you.  ---------------------------------- Of course the food is good at CPK, but I'm writing this review because the customer service for this location was horrible. Our waiter was nice but we sat outside and we were forgotten. It wasn't even that busy. We got ONE cup of water the entire time. No one checked on us, and when I asked for the check, we had to wait half an hour because no one would bring it out. Ridiculous.

Okay, so it's literally across the street from my residence. I've been going off and on for years & I've had 30-40% of the menu selections; I can't remember any complaints in the past as far as quality, freshness, temperature, or presentation of the dish.  Their oven for pizza baking is interestingly interesting, so say the least. Prices are fairly reasonable; managers are active on the floor & from time to time will introduce themselves to the seated guests when duty hasn't solicited them elsewhere.  The only thing that really set me off with the pay system at this establishment is at the bottom of the receipt it breaks down the tipping amount based on one's individual tab in increments of 15, 18, & 20%. Again, that's based on the cost of the tab & is quite helpful as far as illuminating one having to calculate.  The problem is they base tip recommendations on the entire tab (including the tax) and that's not supposed to be.  EXAMPLE: if my meal total is $5 & with tax it's $5.45  the tip recommendation chart of 15, 18, or 20%, is supposed to be on the $5, not the $5.45. Where is it written that we're supposed to tip tax?  Please tell me because I do stand to be corrected if I'm wrong. But the tax wasn't served to me on a plate nor did the tax give me service, so why should I tip a tab whose total includes the tax? Yes, the $5 is taxable, hence the $5.45, but the $5 alone is what I'm supposed to tip (if I choose), not the $5.45.  I brought it to the attention of my waiter who was working the bar that particular day, but it was kinda' shrugged off as if it was nonexistent. I don't think anyone has ever challenged it or paid any attention to it, but I caught the subliminal trick of mild robbery. gain, I stand to be corrected; each one teach one and I strive to learn something new every day.

Unbelievably lousy.  Can't make a pizza correctly.  It's in the name of the chain and yet 3 tries, they can't get it right.  Plus they try to pass of a NY strip as a ribeye.  I know it's a pizza place but I've had the ribeye at a few other locations and it's really good.  They "comp'd" our meal but since nobody ate anything, what's the point?  Brooke was our server and she was absolutely terrible.  Horrific.  Pure crap.

Stopped in at this CPK at 9PM after a 10-hour day of sightseeing in LA.  We were tired, our feed hurt and we were starving.  The hostess greeted us with a big smile and we were seated promptly.  She promised to take our aches and pains away and fill us with great food. Our waitress arrived promptly and took our drink order.  We each ordered two drinks, LoL, and said to bring water AFTER the drinks were gone.  We needed Al Cohol to ease away our tired feet and locked up back muscles. Drinks arrived and we downed the first set.  Then ordered.  One pizza, one chicken dish and one pasta dish.  Waitress asked if we wanted bread and in unison we all said, "YES!"  Three minutes later three loafs of hot, fresh out of the oven, Italian bread, appeared on our table. Salads arrived, excellent ... and a third round of drinks was delivered. Food arrived, excellent ... and a fourth round of drinks was delivered. Dessert.  Yes, we ordered dessert and a fifth round of drinks.  :-) Overall the experience was great, the servers were on point and on time, and the food was excellent even though we were starving and would have eaten bark off a tree at that point. In the end, five rounds of drinks were consumed with two on empty stomachs.  Thank goodness Uber was there to take us home to our hotel!

Fantastic and fresh food, the pizzas fresh and made right in front of you.  You can order a little bit of things other than pizza and there is a large selection of toppings. If you go too much, you will end up ordering the same thing. Great place overall.
Good pizza and pasta. When you enter you get some bread with oil to eat as appetizer. We tried the BBQ pizza and the pesto pasta, after the lunch we were full!
Atmosphere was great!! Prices are fairly reasonable if you pay on your own. Its a great place to split with a friend! The food was very good. The waitress i had was very nice!

The consummate California gourmet pizza eatery.   High energy atmo, with an open kitchen, cozy booths, attentive wait staff and the requisite bus boy with a spec script he wants u to take a look at.  Everything's in season all year long in California, so you're safe with anything on the menu. Its so LA, you feel like you're in NYC. Orders can be placed for carry-out.   Arik Katzenberg April 1, 2017

The service and the quality of food are wildly inconsistent. I live in Hollywood so I have been here many times over the years but finally decided that I didn't want to run the risk of being unpleasantly surprised anymore.

I Come Here At Least Once A Week. The Lunch Specials Are Good, The Drinks & Food Are Delicious & The Staff Is Friendly. They Have A Reward Program So It Makes It Easy To Get Free Appetizers. They Validate For Parking & They Don't Ever Have A Long Wait!

I stopped in and had A hard time choosing  What to eat because  The selection was  Fantastic!  Ended up choosing  The pasta and pizza . It was delicious! Our waiter Mohammed Showed excellent  Customer service skills  By being courteous, Checking up on us frequently , And he was prompt on  Bringing our orders out . Manager came around and  Asked how everything was. If you are looking for great Service and food try  California pizza kitchen on Hollywood Blvd.

3.5 Stars. Went here for dinner after a day of fun with the family in Hollywood. Wanted to eat somewhere a bit different but since we had the whole family we decided to  choose a sure thing, and it paid off. My wife hit the gluten free pizza and I got a sausage, pepperoni and mushroom pizza. We both enjoyed the pizzas very much.  Service was good and overall it was a good experience. Great place to go to get a good meal that won't break the bank.

I appreciate CPK in Hollywood for the quick resolution to my past awful experience. Within days of my Yelp review the CPK Corporate office reached out to me and had the manager reach out to me as well. It is nice to see a chain restaurant who cares about there customers. While I won't change my original review, the customer service at CPK deserves 5 stars.

It seems that if you want to work at the California pizza kitchen you have to be a gentleman with a bun. My guest and I were commenting on how many of the employees had their hair in a bun we found it quite entertaining. The food is overpriced and under flavored. Spaghetti Bolognese was a small portion and it was very dry seemed like it had been created almost like a cookie-cutter fast food recipe approach no passion. The pizza had mushrooms that were bad tasting & on the verge of being just bad as in rotting and my guest suffered stomach issues for the rest the day afterward. I tasted the pizza and then quickly realized the mushrooms that were on the pizza were not fresh.  I hate giving bad reviews but this place is going BUNDER.  I was going to give three stars... but my guest said no two!
I had margarita pizza and strawberry and mango cooler, pizza tasted good when it is hot, a lot of cheese on it. Service is good as well.

I stopped into California Pizza Kitchen after a show. The halibut dinner exceeded my expectations. The fish was fresh and moist. The Faro risotto with butternut squash was topped with asparagus, and both were so delicious. I loved it so much that I emailed CPK and asked for the recipe. I also really like that the menu gives you wine suggestions to go with the meal. The place was only a little busy, and it is a good place to go to after you have seen a live performance in the Hollywood and Highland complex.

CPK is a safe place to eat.  You will always find something to eat but don't expect anything spectacular.   One of the best things at CPK is free - the bread.  The baguettes are fluffy on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  Served warm, dip these babies in the olive oil concoction and enjoy! The Chinese chicken salad is mediocre at best.  The chicken is salty and they toss it in dressing, but then put another teriyaki-type glaze again on top.  Super over-sauced =( This location in the Kodak theater is huge.  There's outdoor seating and bar seating as well.

We had a great server here by the name of Abel. What a fantastic job he did. Very attentive to our family. I'm giving this place a three star only because the host Vanessa in my opinion is not the right person to be hosting this establishment. Poorly trained and inpatient. The Rolling of her eyes very unprofessional. We sat outside with our family and saw her do that to multiple people. Might want to look into that California Pizza Kitchen.

I actually came here few weeks ago and I forgot to review this place. I had a HORRIBLE experience because there was basically ZERO service. The waiter came to our table saying he was our server for a day. He was no where to be seen after he got our orders for a drink and our order for the food. We were about to order our food but he was NOWHERE to be seen. I could see just WALKING AROUND DOING NOTHING. I couldn't get his attention so I asked someone else. It was a young lady and she said she will get him for us. We ordered the food but AGAIN he gave ZERO F about us. I could clearly see him so he never clocked out. I was not able to get his attention. He walks by us and I called his name. He just walks pass by us casually. HORRIBLE SERVICE. The same young lady got our food for us. I wanted a refill of my drink but I couldn't because more people came in and it was just impossible to ask for a drink to different waiter/waitress. It was a DISASTER. By the way it wasn't even that busy when we came here. A lot of people but not that many to forget who you are serving.  I have been to multiple CPK and correct me if I am wrong but does this CPK let you walk in and out from the kitchen? Because they clearly give ZERO F and don't care what you need. It is IMPOSSIBLE to ask for more water. WATER! For those who is going to come here, I think you can walk in and grab anything you want from the kitchen. There aren't any servers so no one cares. Just don't bother the chefs. You don't want to distract them from making mediocre food.  Food: 3/5 Service: 0/5

I arrived with a large party on a busy weekend afternoon. The hostess was nice and gave us quote time and stuck to it. Our server was amazing - despite being really busy he made sure to always check in on us and gave us plenty of attention. There was a small mishap with one of our dishes but the server and manager were very polite about it and quick to fix the problem. I was very pleasantly surprised by the great customer service that we received. The food was also very yummy!

Delicious pizzas but also fantastic soups & salads! Never been here for dinner but love this place for lunch, it can be a bit expensive, but worth it. During the week it's easier to get seated, and waited on. Everyone's meal was completely devoured.

My wife is gluten free, they have a small menu to cater to her sensitivity! The hostess Mary was very pleasant and answered questions we had asked and gave us waters as we waited for our server. Once seated we were greeted by Brenna who took our order and gave us bread. Herbert was nice enough to clear our table for us as we waited for our bill. They worked really well as a team to make sure our needs were met! Great BBQ pizza! They also have a great lunch deal with a 7" pizza and soup or salad. Definitely will be coming back!

I'm usually a fan of CPK but this location had the worst service. Our waiter gave us 3 bread crumbs while the tables around us (with the same party size) got decent sized bread plates. I'm a bread lover so YES I care and it matters. Food took forever to come out and my moms salad was forgotten so she had to eat our pizza first then have her salad after the fact which is totally not the right order. She asked for a refill twice and was ignored. I was tempted to get up and pour it myself. Even asking for the check and paying was a long drawn out process. I couldn't help but wonder if we were being ignored on purpose- like did we remind him of someone he had strongly disliked in a previous life? Was he taking it out us? Whatever the issue, I will not be returning and will choose another establishment to go to pre- Hollywood bowl concert.
I loved the service! Jason the guy who took my order was awesome! He even had some funny jokes! The British manager Go was Vee y sweet also! I really enjoyed the carne as Ada pizza! It was bomb!
My favorite place in Hollywood! You need to try "The original barbecue pizza" ... nothing better than that ... great atmosphere, nice people and amazing location.
The classic crispy chicken half sandwich was dry and tough and the chicken size was tiny.

After being told that the patio was closed at Dave & Buster's we came here with loftier expectations. The hostess explained that only one side of the patio was open. Again? Geez, the show lets out we are a little humid because we are warm and we HOPE that some time in fresh air is available. That would be too perfect. Instead, we are forced to sit inside the bar. Our first inclination is to belly up but there are used plates and utensils strewn about. After standing there for a few minutes the bartender acknowledges our existence understanding some primping of the area in front of us is needed. We are standing for a few minutes MORE when we realize he has no intention of taking care of this issue quickly. We find a bar top and notice many tables with remnants of patrons past. Dirty dishes, food, glasses and so on. I hate to be prissy but this is Saturday FREAKIN' night and crowds are expected especially with it being a concert night.  Either the restaurant was improperly staffed or management was lacking BIGTIME!! Needless to say we had some time to kill with two bottles of Pinot from Buena Vista in Sonoma. I have to admit that I was livid and uncomfortable for a while until the infusion of fermented wine grapes relaxed me. Dontae' was our server and he was congenial and attentive. We have a CPK we love here in our neck of the desert but this is one I would avoid visiting in the future.
I found a blonde hair in my waldorf salad. Nice friendly waiter, but where's the bread?  Ok, bread just arrived but  we're done with the  meal.

First time eating at this CPK.  Came for a quick bite before the show.  We got seated quickly upon arrival.  Our server was really nice and foods were average.  Plenty of parking in the parking structure.  Restaurant does validate your parking so be sure to ask.  This is a busy location, situated right next to Starbucks shop.

We dropped in late after a Hollywood movie premiere so it was busy busy busy. But that didn't stop the concierge greeting everyone, kids included, and he didn't miss opening the door for anyone coming into the restaurant all night. We had a fantastic waiter who was engaging and aware of when to hover and when to move on. The food was excellent and we were surprised by the quality wine selection. All in all a great place for a casual but quality meal.

Lesson learned... DO NOT order steak at a pizza place. It looked so good on the menu photo so I figured.. why not? Normally when you price a steak that high, it should come out good. It was totally undercooked. I said medium rare and it was basically cut off the cow and just warmed up. They had to throw it back on. The flavor wasn't very good. The worst part was the hard fat all through steak. Half of it was not even edible. I never should have paid for that. Very disappointed.

This could have easily been a one or two star experience if it hadn't been for Steve the manager, who made sure that the wait staff corrected our order ( we came with a large group and there was some confusion) ; he also made sure that we got our drink orders in time as well.   Outside of this, the product coming out of this kitchen was actually, surprisingly good....delicious, I'm even tempted to say...  everything from the salads to the jambalaya to the pastas were outright well executed, none overseasoned, and the ingredients noticeably fresh and of good quality.   In a touristy area near the Manns Chinese theatre, this place has lots of foot traffic so don't expect a quiet dinning experience. A good option for a sit-down lunch or dinner if you're visiting the area.   A big thanks again to Steve the manager for making sure our night ended on a good note.
My family always choose CPK....great selections but we have to wait long for the food to be served and we have to ask for the bread, before they give it prior to ordering :(

Me and my girlfriend came in today and we got one of the best waiter he name is Abel really nice guy and very attentive and even suggested a few thing thanks.The food was very good and the pasta too will be back !

2015 YELP 100 CHALLENGE - 036/100 Not the best location I've been to, unfortunately. But this place is packed all the time because of the location so I guess it's expected. I got the spicy chicken pizza which was completely soggy. My friend's pasta was really tasteless too. And the spinach & artichoke dip came with totally stale chips. They were hard, couldn't even bite into them!

As a former server I usually do not like throwing people under the bus, but this time I really need to make an exception. I have been to this location dozens of times and I've never been provided with such sub-par service. My friends and I all had crazy, long days of work, and the place was decently busy but we all had a hankering for our CPK favorites. We got seated, and as soon as Trenton walked up to us (after 15 minutes and only after my fiancé went over and complained to someone) we immediately knew we were in trouble. He was spaced out, sluggish, hard to communicate with, and we had to repeat our orders multiple times because every time he'd read them back it's all be wrong. He made us all extremely uncomfortable with the way he presented himself, and we all braced ourselves for what we knew would be a terrible meal. We didn't get drinks (or the water we requested) for ten plus minutes, and three other tables with people who'd arrived after us were getting their food. I approached Trenton about this and asked him if we could expect our food soon, as we had been waiting over thirty minutes and we hadn't seen him at all. He gave me a patronizing look, as if it were amusing, and made up a bunch of excuses I knew to be untrue. Over then next fifteen minutes he brought each of our dishes one at a time, and once it was all set down we didn't see him again for twenty more minutes. The whole time he moved slow as molasses and seemed to be extremely spaced out. My fiancé and I had not expected to be there so long, and we both had to be up for work at the crack of dawn and had to leave early. Those of you that have been to CPK know that the average turnaround time is no more than 40 minutes. We were there for nearly two hours. Like I said at the beginning, I was a server and used to get peeved when I got these kind of complaints, but I worked at a fine dining restaurant, and Trenton would've gotten the boot in less than a week. Rethink deploying Trenton during high volume nights, and possibly consider posting him as busboy.

Lots of different thin crust pizzas. If you're looking for a little different, instead of just a cheese or pepperoni pizza this place is for you. There are a lot of these Cal Pizza locations throughout the South bay. You won't be disappointed. Reasonable priced pizza.

Sounds silly, but this is easily one of my favorite date spots. My boyfriend and I almost always sit at the bar where we get seated and served very quickly, split a bottle of wine, and enjoy good food and conversation. The close proximity to the Chinese Theater as well as the rest of Hollywood Blvd. makes it an ideal place to start a night on the town. Highly recommend!
Loved this place! The service was excellent and we had an amazing Bbq chicken pizza. The price is very reasonable as well. We will be back again.

its my first time here food was good and my server her name Brooke she did really good job but i was sorry that she have to handle with bad family who really too much next to my table i wish you have a good day

I think CPK is pretty damned good. Across the board, their food is tasty, and their service is good.  The review could easily end there, but if you're picky, read: I understand when people find me difficult to please. And while all of their staff does a good job, I'm particularly grateful for the hostess, Mary, who always deals with all the little requests and nuances of my order and does it with a sincere smile. To the management, and from one employer to another -- if you fail to acknowledge talent you're likely to lose it. My recommendation would be to make her a server. Your customers deserve her level of service -- and she in turn, deserves a position which is paid for their level of performance, not just attendance.  Please know, I don't personally know her nor do I have any ulterior motive. I merely know first hand the importance of advancing deserving people.

Simply put, great service and very pleasant people. BBQ chicken chopped salad is the way to go. The spicy chicken chipotle pizza is honestly the best thing I've had in a while. You can do curbside pick up for your convenience. The food is typically ready in 15 minutes!!! Love you guys.

Our waiter Trenton, introduced himself as our waiter and indicated that he would need to make some deliveries.  I asked if we could put in our order, which he said no because he has to deliver some food.   Um, okay. So we waited and waited and waited.  Trenton never returned - never.  We saw him at other neighboring tables, except ours. Instead, the host who had seated us, took our order and returned multiple of times.  The bartender, also assisted by delivering food and taking our dessert request.  They really went out of their way, and we are very thankful.  There was a mix-up with our food, which caused our food to be delayed.  Instead of a bbq chicken children's pizza, we received the hawaiian.  This error was taken off our bill.   I wish there was a comment card to fill out, which I would have given praise to the host and the bartender who assisted us very graciously.   I wish I had gotten their names.  I'm not sure if they are part of management, or if they just went out of their way.   Either way, to the host and bartender, thank you for an enjoyable dining experience.  Five stars for your generosity and hospitality. Four stars for the restaurant as they seemed understaffed.

This place was a total joke. The waitstaff and servers do not have leadership or training that enable them to be able to deal with the amount of volume of traffic this place gets. They will basically take in the most frustrated or inpatient people before the people who wait their turn. I guess they get so much business that they don't really have to strive for excellence. We called ahead with a large group and were told 30 minutes. When we checked in at the desk we were told 10 minutes. An hour and a half later with many many check ins, we were still not seated. We continued to ask for a ballpark time so we can adjust our plans. We were finally told that were next.  Then, a group of the same size as ours get seated before us! I walked up to tell the server that we were there much longer waiting before. One of the ladies in the party looks to me and says a racist comment about how Caucasian people are always sat before her race and how this restraint is racist if they don't seat them next. Then they are seated. I talk to the manager and asked why they were seated and he said because they made a racist comment pulled the "race card" and they had to protect the restaurant.  Anyway I thought it was ridiculous and we ended up all getting split up because they couldn't accommodate us after that. I think the whole issue was handled very unprofessional and I actually feel bad for the staff because they just seemed overwhelmed and stressed. They seriously need some leadership help at this place...,
Awesome customer service with Abbie, Gaurav the manager, Abel,  & Jose the host- outside the front door!
Great staff and location. Food was not the best and expensive. Seemed mass produced and certainly not fresh.

I tried to call for carry out here and couldn't understand anyone on the phone. I checked the menu beforehand and couldn't find sides to order anywhere on it so I asked the person in the phone to which he spewed off so fast I had no idea. I hung up to look at the actual website menu for this location and wanted to get a baked potato and salad-AS LISTED. So when I call back, they don't have baked potatoes?!? Done, waste of time and probably wouldn't get the order right anyway

It was a Wednesday evening when we came to eat here. The husband and I have been to a few CPK places, and weren't disappointed until this visit. I know this is in a tourist area, but that being said you'd think the service would be better. It wasn't crowded at all when we came here for dinner around 7. Our waiter didn't really check on us, nor did he ever refill our drinks. Just took our drink orders and then food orders. There were a few times when I could see him standing with other waiters just joking around to the right of the bar. I noticed other patrons looking around a bit for their waiter as well.  Pizza we had was so-so. Pepperoni pizza the kids ordered was super greasy. Waiter didn't check on us to ask how our food was and after the food came out the only other time we saw him was when he brought the bill. I do try and take things into consideration when it comes to servers, but it was obvious the wait staff would rather joke around than serve the guests. Really sad.
I love it here have the avocado egg rolls the CA club pizza or the chipotle spicy chicken pizza and the butter cake!!!!
Slow slow slow slow.  Did I mention slow.   Wow, you would think for being at such a high profile high traffic place they would have their act together.

It was my first time in LA and my first time at CPK. I learned it is a chain restaurant. The pizza I had was really good. I got a special pizza of the week. A Thai pizza with chicken, bean sprouts, sweet chili sauce and more asian ingredients. I really liked it. My girlfriend had a very delicious salad with avocado and artichokes. Drinks wer ok too, price above average. I would go there again.
The pizza looks more as a focaccia but not bad! It's on 15$ each plus tips, it's just small portion!

Incredible service and excellent pizza. We were pleasantly surprised to find such a great pizza place with wine that surpasses fine dining restaurants. And our waiter, Josue, was brilliant and courteous with a manner that you would expect from an upscale restaurant. It's the food that matters but what distinguishes ordinary places from extra-ordinary is the attention to detail, the pleasant smile and welcoming attitude. I think Josue shows this and, to be honest, all (yes all) other folks we met in this exquisite city of Los Angeles show this in their humbling 'welcome to my city' persona. To all the folks in this great city that care, thank you.

We found this place accidentaly in our walk exploring the area. The food was actually delicious. Don't normally have pasta dish outside my house, however they actually brought me the pasta "al dente" as requested. Yum. Waiter was friendly and attentive. Nice location away from the madness of the boulevard. Great to be able to sit outside and enjoy the view of the Hollywood sign.

We visited CPK on a Saturday afternoon at about 1pm in the busy Hollywood and Highland Center.   We were seated promptly.  This restaurant appears to be much smaller than your typical CPK; however, everything was efficient. We ordered a pizza and a salad to share.  The food was well presented, colorful, and delicious.  We received the food very quickly.  I liked the open kitchen concept, and the fact that you can see the pizzas being made from the main portion of the restaurant. The one star deduction is because the server knew nothing about the loyalty program when we had questions, and she said "we don't really know anything about it either".   Other than that, I would likely return again to this location.

I was a fan of this place until the other day. I will NEVER go back in there. Our waiter approached us laughing at some inappropriate comments made with the other coworker and couldn't even take our order right. kept saying is that it before we could finish our order!!  And worst of all walked away before the last one of us placed an order.  How rude!!!! Customer service is the face of your business, how can it not be a priority! I just can't understand specially in this location.  Pizza was waiting back there for a while before we received it because again there was more talking among employees than working. Cold pizza:  The worst!!  I hate cold food. I expected more. I give up on not just this location but all of them.  I had family visiting. How embarrassing.   You've lost my business and everyone else's I can earn about this.

The pizza is delicious and the crust is amazing!! Nice and crispy on the outside and chewy like rice cakes on the inside! I ordered a Hawaiian pizza and it's One of the best pizzas I've ever had. Next time I will ask them for more onions tho! The service was really good too.
This place is so friendly and has good food I always have the crispy chicken sandwich off the hook. Try it out

Pros- Smiling servers Not a long wait time Good food Nice interior Noise lvl is ok Cons- Complimentary whatever the last person ate with my knife(see picture) Bread came after the pizza? Wow ok Tables are set up so you bump with whoever is sitting behind you (get the booth) Second time here and my response is "meh"

Went to this restaurant in Hollywood and it was great!  The waitress was nice and very prompt with service.  The white corn guac with nachos is AMAZING. The margherita pizza with pepperoni is also A+.  I got their new honey strawberry with white wine mixed drink.  I can't remember the name of it unfortunately but that was sooooo good!  Probably one of the best fruity drinks I've ever had!  This CPK is great and I would totally return if I wasn't on vacation!!

You know exactly what you're getting with CPK, but this location is a step up from others we've been to. A recent renovation has done well by this place. It looks and feels modern, and (shockingly) the new ribeye steak was as good as many I've had in steakhouses in LA at twice the price. But I wouldn't have bothered to review if we hadn't recently had an outstanding experience with a server names Abbie. She was top-notch, definitely exceeding our expectations for service in a quick casual chain like this. Thanks so much, Abbie!
Great food and great service.  Ate at the bar and was served by Dallas!!!  He was awesome and did not miss one beat. Will definitely visit again when in Hollywood. Food was great!!!

So my friends and I were on our way to the Hollywood Bowl and needed some food to take up the hill.  I called CPK about 20 minutes before we were getting to Hollywood and Highland.  The employee was very kind and took my order over the phone.  I told her I would be there in 20 and she said perfect.   I walked in and went straight to the take out counter.  The cashier asked if I was Chris and I said yes.  Must have been the only to-go order.  But everything was ready.  She even remembered that I requested extra bread and butter.  She threw in some cheese and peppers for the thai chicken pizza I got too.  My bf ordered the kung pao spaghetti.  While we didn't really eat the food for at least a half hour when we got into the concert, the food was still warm.   Everything was tasty.  The chain is pretty consistent.  Not the most amazing pizza I have every had, but definitely worth the price for prompt service.  I think I have eaten at this location once before, but when I went in, it was really crowded.  Definitely recommend the to-go option.  Then go out and enjoy the crazy sights at the Hollywood and Highland complex.
Sure, there's a wait, but the pizza is delicious. Oh, and if your health is not something you're too concerned about, I highly recommend the fried mac n cheese.

This is one of those places where I will never come back to. The host was really nice. But when it came to the waiter he seemed to rush us into our order.  My friend asked for a recommendation on a pizza and he made it seem as if the one we trusted him with was "phenomenon" when in reality it wasn't even great at all. The pasta was dry when it clearly said on the menu that it was "creamy."  And their 4.99 guacamole and chips is such a disappointment! I'm not a picky eater but I won't eat something that was in the making of a rush.

I love CPK but this place is more for tourist rather than locals. But nevertheless sevice here is always amazing. Food is fast and has great selections of pizza. For locals try avoiding weekends for it gets a bit crowded. This place is really good with kids and group of friends. So come on down. If your a sweet tooth. Try Salted Caramel Pudding.. Heaven!! But personaly I love their Tiramisu. Soft, delicate pair with coffee!

Who wants Kung Pao Spaghetti! I know I do. It seems California Pizza Kitchen has become a staple every time my sister, my good friend and I celebrate the end of a busy work week. This CPK is actually very convenient as it is in the Hollywood & Highland area - the place where all the action happens! Located in the The H&H structure, parking & getting around is not at all a problem. For starters try the Spinach Artichoke dip---definitely a must! If you are craving for the nice warm bread to start, you have to ask for it as it is not something that they automatically bring to your table anymore ( great idea to avoid unnecessary waste! ) Let's get on to the food! I had the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine- great choice! The pasta was cooked to perfection, the chicken pieces - hefty & well seasoned, the sauce was creamy, buttery, with a hint of citrus - the meal was delicious!   My sister had the Kung Pao Spaghetti which she had me try - OMG! it was so good! It was the perfect twist to something we commonly think as an Italian dish! The Kung Pao spaghetti is gluten free! and for peeps allergic to peanuts, you could request it to be "off" the dish. The four cheese ravioli which my good friend had was scrumptious! (of course my fork dove in that plate too ha ha!) Little square temptations under the blanket of molten cheese and sauteed mushrooms, drizzled with fresh green basil ribbonettes, it smells fresh & rich!  Lastly, I just want to give credit to their nice waiters/servers! Having & enjoying good food is something, but to have a great server makes the whole experience delightful. Enjoy your meal!

Asked for an outside table and hostess pointed to table that needed cleaning. We said fine. Next thing we knew, someone else was getting the table. We did not understand so we asked for the manager. I explained to the manager & said I felt discriminated against. The hostess blurted out "REDNECK" and stormed away. WHAT....Must have hit the nail on the head

Great service! Good food...definitely get the Thai chicken, tostada chicken or BBQ chicken pizzas. Salads are really good too. Seems like they have moved away from their basic menu by adding things like lobster and steak. I would go to other places for those items...but the pizza is still really good, especially with the wheat crust.

I remember when CPK first came to California - or was it born here?  Anyway, we had one in the local mall installed and it was the greatest thing since sliced bread.  Personally, I enjoy slicing my own hand-baked bread in the comfort of my own home.  I can go as THICK as I want and no one can tell me otherwise!  Then I slather copious amounts of real butter on and .... oooops ... Back to the review of CPK Hollywood ... Been here many times and it's always crowded but the wait moves along pretty quickly.  The place is clean and looks cool.  The staff are attentive and always seem to get the orders right.  I like this place, because it's a just a little teeny bit off the main drag where all the crazies are but close enough you can get your whacko fix within a minute assuming you don't stop by Papa's right down the stairway (which is a must). I'm a little angry that they got rid of the BLT Pizza!  I loved that one because the lettuce was finely chopped and the pizza tasted just like a BLT sandwich.  Yum.  Instead they killed that entree and substituted a "California Club" the waiter says.  It's just like the BLT but it also includes chicken.  Okay, what the heck?  So, out comes the pizza and it's basically a full on mixed greens salad placed right on top of the pizza.  With the BLT at least you could pick it up and eat it without having that much fall off.  These are huge pieces of lettuce that you need to cut with a knife before you can insert it in your mouth!  So, I pick up a slice as carefully as possible and at least 80% of the salad falls to the plate just as I get it in my mouth.  So, I end up having a few more slices, then grab my fork and eat my ... side salad.  Maybe it's executed nicely in the kitchen, but I doubt the chef has actually eaten this mess.  Now it was tasty, but not what I expected. The rest of the group got pepperoni pizzas and fish tacos.  All of it was great and we didn't even ask for a doggie bag this time.  Two beers and a pizza!  Buuuuurp!

location: Griffith Park/Los Feliz, Los Angeles, CA
review: Wow I just told the server to turn off the heater and he said something weird and he couldn't so disappointing.
Came here family night with my kids n husband once loved there variety of pizza menu grate food good friendly service.
I love the salads in this place! I always try a different one and I am never disappointed! They are big though! I always order half bowl.

Me and a friend of mine cane here to eat dinner before watching a premiere screening of The Hobbit.  As we walked in,  the host came right up to us and introduced himself and sat us to the table.  I ordered the full chinese chicken salad and my friend ordered the Kung Pao Spaghetti.  The salad was delicious and big.  I was full after eating my salad.  His spaghetti was good.  The waiter was great and the service was great.

I would avoid this location if possible. It's filled with noisy tourist groups. There were large tables of multiple families with squealing children.  Unsupervised children playing in the aisles surrounded us while we tried to eat dinner before going to a movie at the Chinese IMAX. The food at this location is also not up to par with other CPK locations. The server was great, and we got our food in a timely manner, but we won't be going back.

I have been to this CPK location with a friend twice during my stay in LA (and we only stayed for 2 days). We just loved it! The first time I took a Caesar salad which was tasty and filling. The second time I went for the Chipotle pizza. It was very spicy but still very good. I would definitely take it again.

I go to Hollywood A LOT, and I eat at CPK A LOT, but never have I eaten at the Hollywood CPK until recently. I usually come to Hollywood  with friends and we either grab something at Famima or dine at Mel's.  It's not any different than your regular, run of the mill California Pizza Kitchen, the food is great, the bread is always cold and tasteless as the butter they give you, and the waiters always friendly and sweet. It's always busy, so don't expect the waiter to check up on you every few minutes, but they don't do a bad job. Keep in mind, in shopping malls they add the gratuity to the bill (ours was about 20% for five people.) Recommended choice: The Greek Pizza, MY GAWD! This stuff is made from the tears of Jesus himself. The tziki sauce is just AMAZING. I don't recommend this if you're on a hot date, because your breath will be dank. Unless your significant other is into that, I don't judge.

I believe in eating local when you are traveling but after 4 days of very bad, very expensive food in LA we decided to go with something we knew would be good. Had the wedge salad which was great -- the lettuce was fresh and crisp, the bacon crunchy, the dressing perfect and plenty of tomatoes on top.   Next my sister and I shared the pear and gorgonzola pizza -- AMAZING!!! We took an order of chicken piccata back to my mom in the hotel which she said was excellent. The one thing CPK needs to work on is their bread.  It is ridiculously plain, ordinary and bad.  Either do it right or don't do it at all.
like the vibe, not as busy as other ones... Our waiter was really nice and sweet :),  the place looked clean...cant complain... food was delish! .got a 3 course dinner for two $50. not bad.

One of my favorite BBQ chicken pizzas but def a little too pricey for what it is. Don't know if it's the location (Hollywood) but always seems like I spend more then I think I would just for some pizZa. I do love there gluten free BBQ chicken too which is usually what I get when I do go.
Love their ginger dumplings! Also tried their new chicken avocado egg rolls...not so good. You only taste the greasy/fried wonton. Service was pretty slow which kept me from giving them 5 stars.

My first time here and it was pretty good!  Got a small plate for free for signing up for something and split their original pizza, and all in all, was pretty cheap.   Not blown away by anything, so I deducted a star.   And it's a chain,  So I deducted another. But, other than that- sure, if you've never been,  pop on in and try it out.
Went here twice during our week's stay in Hollywood. Nice outdoor seating with a view of the Hollywood sign. My personal favorite was the baked potato soup - yummy!  Wait staff was slow.

Since working near by I've been coming to this location a numerous amount of times. I mean just look at my check ins ;) Great service, great food, great atmosphere! Favorites: Cobb Salad: Love all the ingredients on it. All the essentials for a perfect salad. Chicken, Avocado, Tomatoes, Eggs, Bacon, Lettuce (of course) and optional beets. Chicken Tequila Fettucine: All time favorite: Linguine, Chicken , Onions and Bell peppers (I sub mushrooms). Chicken piccata-flavorful lemon,capers, spegattini, and chicken breast you'll see me again soon CPK!

Went here with my dad we both got pizza and it was delicious. They are very pricey for what you get, but it does seem upscale and we didn't have to wait really for our food . I recommend it if your looking for good pizza and want to got some place nice...

Came here for lunch and it was not a great experience. The hostesses were outside standing talking about some drama in the restaurant. I arrived and stood there right in front of them and no one greeted us until I said "hi. Table for 2?" And then one looked at me and said "ok." And kept talking. Until they finally sat us, she didn't mentioned any specials. She just mumbled something then walked off. Totally rude. Then the server came and greeted me. She was nice. But the food was not good. I got the pesto penne. It was dry, and the pasta was hard. Would not recommend. Bad experience at this location. And By the way, they do not have garlic bread.
I got the artichoke pizza and the butter cake which was SOO good, I don't wen want to know the calories, will definitely be returning for lunch again this week

Elly is #1 makes my day seeing her sweet smile whenever I come into this location. I'm happy to be a regular here! Service always great and food is even better. Angel rocks also! They both make Cpk a beautiful place not just for families but solo too.

GLUTEN FREE - This is one of the best places to stop and grab a bite to eat while walking the stars! Not only is it $5 to $7 cheaper per entree than Hard Rock Cafe, but once you make your way up the stairs there is a lookout where you can clearly see the "HOLLYWOOD" sign & take pics! BE AWARE: those metal ledges get HOT, so don't lean on them for your pics!  I shared a GF pizza with a friend that wasn't GF and she could hardly tell the difference! We also split their cobb salad which was great!!  We got the artichoke dip as an app & it was pretty amazing also, though not GF!  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you get hungry while perusing the walk of stars!!

Where to start... The turn around time is S L O W... Many open tables and people standing outside for no reason. When I was finally seated, our server came and took our drink orders. I stated I was ready to order but he was already on his way getting our drinks. The funny part was that he came back with wrong drinks. In a hurry to get the drinks but didn't properly hear what drinks. HAH! He then went to get the drinks we ordered... When he came back I FINALLY ordered...  1. Chips and Gauc - White and blue chips with white corn guacamole. It wasn't bad.. Nothing special though. I don't know if I'll get it again. 2. The works pizza -  Disappointed... Almost like frozen pizza from the toaster oven. Will NOT get again! 3. The Original BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad - I love this salad!!! I got the full and added avocados for an additional $2.60. Because of their SLOW service, I was late to a show and had to togo the rest of my food. Never coming here even with an hour and 30 minutes to spare!

This restaurant is definitely going through a transition.  It seems as if it is separating itself from the family booth style and replacing it them with reclaimed wood square tables, going for the italian and rustic feel.  It's not bad at all, it actually gives the restaurant a fancier vibe, I just miss the comfy booths (because I am lazy and like to spread out), haha.  The menu has gotten fancier, now offering halibut, healthier options and other items you would not find at CPK two years ago.   Now the reason for the low rating: My husband and I got our main entree, a BBQ chicken pizza, 45 minutes after ordering.  Although our waitress was sweet, the service was super slow and the restaurant was not busy.  Yeah, I know, it's CPK.  Keep your expectations to a reasonable level, Amanda.... But, I mean, if you are part of a chain that mass produces these on the daily, it shouldn't take that long for a pizza.  AM I RIGHT?!?!

I work in the area and eat here a lot.  recently the restaurant seemed to go through a bit transition, not only the interior, but also with staff.  I like the new menu, despite my favorite dish (chicken chimichuri) being removed.  I like the tables, it is better than the banks of booths they had causing awkward walking flow through the restaurant. my complaint is about the service.  3 weeks ago, our waitress was touchy feelie and making weird jokes and did not seem to get the vibe that we were talking and her jokes were weird and uninteresting to us and interrupting our conversation. she thought one of my friends was sleeping, he wasn't his eyes were open, and then called him sleepy the rest of the meal.  the service was quick, and she was attentive, but her table chatter was off putting and weird. a week later i go in,  the service was non existent.  the server came to the table to ask if we wanted refills, but coworker and i said yes.  only i got a refill.  my 2 coworkers were waiting for 20 minutes to try and flag down a server to get a refill.  we also ask for check.  he runs off before hearing us ask for a split bill.  he drops off check and drinks in to go cups. again disappearances for 20 minutes. he splits the check and we wait, yes you guessed it again 10 minutes before i flagged him down and got him to take out payment. i lost my cool a little bit at the end, i just wanted to leave and every time he left the table i was scared he would never come back.  the music was loud, i had a headache.  i would have gotten a dessert for my birthday if we hadn't waited so long for drink refills.   this ended up being a 2+ hour lunch, half of which was trying to find waitstaff for things. i don't feel like i have time enough to eat here now on my lunch breaks because the service is so uneven.

My girlfriend and I decided to come to this CPK after a few games of bowling. As we entered our host took us to our table. Because we were only a party of two, we felt we would rather sit next to each other. Almost immediately our Server relocated us to a big ass booth. But thats not the main point. As we sat down we were greeted by Clinton. First things first, Clinton had such an amazing attitude, bringing smiles to us both. He had excellent service and treated us like royalty. Our food came promptly and he was very patient with us. As we finished up he ran over some to-go boxes and our bill. We quickly paid the bill, and helped clear the table. He thanked us and exchanged a quick conversation. Absolutely an  A++++ server, and i cant wait to deal business with this CPK again. Thanks Clinton!

Some of the worst bubbly I've had. Coke was watered down, poorly portioned. Ice cubes dominated the space inside my glass, very little carbonation. Sadly, everything else in accompaniment to my coca cola made for an even worse meal. *Note that my written review for Coke is stand alone and separate from the star rating. I use the star rating system for my overall experience. But I only choose to verbally review the Coca Cola Classic...because it's classy.

I was there for a dinner with my three kids (4, 2 and 6months) on a Saturday evening. I totally understand that it is not the best timing nor best place to have dinner with three kids. However, regardless of that my experience at the restaurant was overall very satisfactory. Actually, the beginning of the service was very poor. After being seated in an outside seating, I was able to get my drink order very quickly. After that, I had to wait quite some time to be attended to put my dinner order. Not sure how long it took but easily felt like 10-15 minutes as I was watching other customers who came later than us were served. I claimed that I was unattended and then immediately a server named Frankie came to attend us. After that everything was fabulous. A very sincere apology followed by a nachos appetizer on the house. My two simple orders (Hawaiian Pizza and Bolognese Pasta) came instantly! Thanks Frankie!

boyfriend and i had the lunch special while waiting for AGT taping. we thought it was a great deal and although it was filling i would probably spend the extra money and order an entree. the sandwich was mehhh. too much bread & too little meat. the pizza lunch special was also more bread and tasted alright. i didn't feel like it was delicious, just made me full that's all. ALSO, do not sit on the outside patio area if you do not want to be attacked by bees. Not to mention, they forgot to give us our complimentary bread and it took about 15 minutes before we were able to get our waitress to bring us our bread because apparently other waiters/waitresses can't help. OH YEAH, while on the waiting topic, it took them almost an hour to make our food...uhh we just had one sandwich and one small pizza....then our waitress says "your order got lost in their pile" umm okay? and what did they do for us after that? nothing....

This is my second time visiting this location. It's CPK so you're expectations can't be too high.  My friends and I cruised in on Thursday and there was no wait time so that was good.  We ordered the Chipotle Chicken and the White Pizza with Bacon.   Both pizzas were good.  Are they overpriced?  Yes.  But you know that before even coming here.  The main reason we went to CPK wasn't even for their pizza actually.  Say what???  That's right...we came because they have this amazing butter cake topped with ice cream.  OH YES!!!  That is delicious. The service was OK.  The waiter looked like he'd rather be doing something else...but I don't blame him...I would too.

It's a good thing I enjoy the food here so much because the employees aren't that pleasant. My server was nice and I can't complain, he just seemed not overly stoked to be at work on a Saturday. I can't blame him. My real issue was the hostess. I came in to have a nice lunch by myself and she tried to have me sit at the bar in one of those tall chairs. Normally, I'd totally go for this but today I just wanted a comfortable seat by myself. Rather than take a whole 4 person booth, like she tried to direct me to, I politely asked if I could take a small 2 seater in the corner to which she cheerfully responded, "well sure. You've already made up your mind."  My food was good, but because of her passive aggressive comment, my lunch was a little less enjoyable.  Thanks for being so rude.

I'm not sure why all the negative comments but to each his own experience my experience was great! Don my server was a pro at the service game he was professional fun and helpful and all the staff I encountered were very nice and pleasant the jumbolya was well worth its pricecy indulgence and they have a butter cake that will put even most homemade poundcakes to shame ! I've never thought I could be so amazingly overwhelmed at cpk but it was great! ive be exhausted my eating out budget for the rest of the month but food and eating out is my only vice so I did it right !

Do not get the crispy Mac and cheese, it's not what we thought it would be and its kinda gross. The rest of the food was pretty good though. The thing I don't understand is that it appears that some tables get free bread, but some others don't. That doesn't make sense. Our waiter was very frustrating, we couldn't understand what he was saying and he was trying way too hard. He was trying to force us to buy alcohol and dessert which is annoying if you'd already said no. His attitude really put a downer on the experience. The food came out quickly and the pizzas were awesome.

Last night my friends and I decided to have an adventure and go to CPK. We had a long, stressful Friday at work and were in need of delicious food & a strong drink(s).  When arriving at CPK we were immediately greeted by a beautiful southern gentleman named, Clinton. Although he was our server, not the host, he still took the time and showed us to our table. Having suffered a painful looking injury to his finger (possibly broken?) it didn't affect his mood in the slightest. He was upbeat, conversational, knowledgeable about the menu, and overall it was clear that he was making an effort to provide excellent service. We ordered the tortilla spring rolls, specifically the Mediterranean veggie and Baja chicken. Both were great, the perfect nosh to keep us tied over until our main course, the artichoke and spinach pizza. The pizza was cooked perfectly and although it was nowhere near a NYC slice, it was still pretty satisfying. Throughout the meal we ordered mojitos and the blueberry ginger smash. Both were tasty! Clinton provided perfect bedside manner throughout our dinner. His southern twang and impeccable service made our night. He was one of the best servers I've had since living in LA!  A huge thanks to Clinton for a wonderful experience! xoxo CPK Girl

I was happily surprised of the quality of appetizers and pizzas enjoyed by our family at the California Pizza Kitchen.  They also had a pretty good wine list.  Service was pretty good.   Try to eat outside on their patio and watch the people walk by.

1st. Time at CPK, service was great!! But, the food was not. I don't think I'll be back; we order Peperoni pizza, spaghetti Bolognesse, and spinach fetuchini tequila and lime. Honestly only the pizza was ok, pasta looks good but the taste was like when you cook at home something for the 1st time, (looks ok but no taste...) taste mire like frozen food; looks ok but wirh no taste at all. Note when I came back to my hotel I mentioned to the front desk people, and they told me; " I'm so sorry! I didn't know you guys will eat out... Food there is horrible... Next time I will recommend a really good place. A place do I go for dinner. (Shocking!!)

I wanted to write a review specifically for the service. I've eaten at CPK for many years and always love the BBQ chicken salad with avocado and the pizza. The food is always good and the iced tea is my fav. The only thing is that they've recently changed their table bread recipe and I'm not very fond of the new one. As I said, this is a review of the service. We had Clinton as our waiter and could not be happier. The place was slammed since it is a Saturday and during the holidays but he was still nice, polite, quick and remembered everything we requested (water with no ice and the lemon, for example) He made sure to wish us a happy new year and didn't let us walk out with getting a validation. I was very pleased with his attitude and how well he knew the menu. Excellent service, thank you Clinton!

I'm a frequent CPK goer - delicious food, good drinks and classic desserts! They have great specials and deals (like their $30 for two deal - one appetizer, two entrees, and one dessert for $30)!  This particular location had good service and the parking at H&H Center is convenient!

Full bar! Great airy vibe if you sit on their patio on a nice day. Hwood sign in the bkgd & good ppl watching. Lunch special is a great price but not great food compared to the rest of the menu. If you download their app and give them your user ID number you can get a FREE "small plate" from their menu.

im used to amazing food from CPK.  Disappointed 10X over.  we ordered 7 personal pizza's and they were all cold, dry, and rubbery crust.  Bland tasting.  Horrible horrible horrible!  I do recommend CPK.  I do NOT recommend this location.  Seriously, drive the extra couple miles to go to another location, heck I would drive 10 extra miles.  For the price you pay, you should get a fresh, hot, tasty pizza.  You will thank me.

Back in 2003ish, it was one of my life goals to visit every CPK in California because I was obsessed with their Broccoli Sundried Tomato Fusilli menu item. True story. Fast forward to 2012 when I visit my local CPK (Hollywood/Highland) only to discover that it's NO LONGER ON THE MENU! I, reluctantly, ordered the Tomato Basil Spaghettini ($10.00) instead, which is spaghetti, tomatoes, garlic and basil. If this atrocity is supposed to replace the Broccoli Sundried Tomato Fusilli, then our relationship is over, CPK! It was awful. The thick red sauce was SO GARLIC-Y that it was SOUR TASTING! Never again!
I love this place. It never fails me.  The staff is courteous,  the food is great and the music is soulful!

Great place and food always consistent, My family love this place. We always come here at least 2-3 time a month and with menu selection for kids. They never complain if I want to come to this place. Service always good and food always great!!  Definitely come back again and again

This is a chain pizza restaurant that offers some really creative and delicious meal options. There pizza is really well done and in addition they have other great options like steak, salads and pasta.  We were visiting the Hollywood area and found this place in a high end mall next to the Chinese theater. We sat outside with a view of the Hollywood sign and had a great lunch. The servers were attentive and not too pushy and the restaurant was comfortable, clean and pleasant.  We ordered the Thai pizza, Jerk chicken and another and devoured them all. They have a limited selection of beers and although there drafts are pricey at $7, it was worth it. Their flavored ice teas and frozen lemonade is a great choice too.  The bill came to about $70 so it does add up quickly. We definitely could have shared a pizza and they have affordable lunch options. Like pizza with soup or salad.  It's a great choice you won't regret it.

This place only gets a star reviews because I love CPK but definitely not this one. If I could, I would give -2 stars. The service was horrible. We received our food but received dirty silverware. When we asked for it to be replaced it took the FOREVER to bring us back clean silverware. By the time we got our clean silverware, the food was cold. So we got to enjoy cold food. Staff seemed a little unorganized.. Won't be coming back.

Stumbled across this place as its close to our hotel. Good pizza with good pizza base (I'm really picky with base) our waiter gave us a free starter as it was our first visit and gave really good service! Would go back again!

After taking my son and his friend to a movie at the El Capitan Theater we ventured across the street to Hollywood and Highland.  The kids wanted CPK we hunkered up to the counter and were greeted by a very friendly waitress.  The food was par for the course in terms of CPK...middle of the road...good.

Seating: My friend and I were told to wait for 15-20 minutes at around 5:15 P.M. when we got there, yet actually waited for longer than that. I noticed how people who signed in later but were seated earlier than us.  Environment: Good lighting and green plants. I like the general atmosphere even though it could have been quieter. The background pop music did not really match my expectation, but since this is a family restaurant, I shouldn't expect too much.  Serving: We waited for about 10 to 15 minutes before a waiter came to us and took the order. Before he came, there was no waiter around in the area we were seated, and everyone else seemed so busy.  Food: The Avocado Egg Roll was good, but the Garlic Chicken Pizza was not impressive.  Overall: It was overall okay but I wouldn't say that this was a pleasant dining experience.

Amazing place. Got the halibut and honestly have not had a meal this delicious in a VERY long time. Our waiter Scotney was caring, attentive, and truly on point! The manager Luis visited our table for a bit of small talk which made us feel right at home. We will defiantly be coming back not just for the food but the great service as well thanks Scotney!

Reason why I giving one star is because it's been 30 minutes since I ordered my food, service it's really bad !! Waitress all over walking like they don't know sh**t Finally I decided to leave without no one notice, seems they don't care if you leave or stay

This is not my first time at a California Pizza Kitchen, but this is the first time I've been very satisfied with a CPK! After slapping our shoes against the pavement of the walk of fame, fitting our hands in the molds of those of celebrities in front of the Chinese Theater, and admiring the famous Hollywood sign from a far, we realized it wouldn't hurt to get a bite to eat. Thankfully, we found California Pizza Kitchen before I got too loopy from hunger. We were seated quickly and were left to ponder over the menu. After some rumination, the five of us decided to split a Jamaican Jerk pizza and a Thai Chicken pizza. The waiter warned us that between all five of us, we would still be left hungry if we stuck with ordering only two pizzas. We were adamant about our decision.... unfortunately, the waiter was right. The pizzas were pretty small, but the waiter made it clear that they would be. Our Jamaican Jerk pizza definitely had a good kick. The typical ingredients in anything jamaicany or jerky were there. As someone noted, each bite of this pizza was different. On the other hand, though the Thai Chicken pizza was savory and was smothered in a great peanut sauce, every bite was just the same as the last. Nonetheless, both pizzas were very good. Each of us had two pieces, and when we got down to the last two, there was some hesitation as to who would take them. Thankfully, two brave volunteers stepped up to the challenge before all hell broke loose. I don't think I'll make the trip to Hollywood just for some CPK for a while, but if you're in Hollywood, CPK is definitely a great place to grab some grub!

I grew up coming to this particular CPK. I've been a fan of it ever since I was little!  Would you believe me if I said I've tried EVERYTHING on the menu? Well, I havent. I've tried most though!  Currently, my favorite dish is the Kung Pow Spaghetti with added Shrimp. They used to make it with eggs, but I believe they stopped. Honestly, I prefer it better this way!  I think the biggest and only regret I've had about a dish at CPK, was the CheeseBurger Pizza, which in fact, tasted exactly like a cheesebuger! It wasn't bad, but it wasn't something I'd want to try again, nor would I ever reccomend it. It's also off the menu now in most resturaunts. This place is VERY family friendly! It also has a great view of the Hollywood Sign!  TOURIST FRIENDLY! You must go there at least once!

Decided to eat here when I was exploring the Hollywood walk of fame with a friend and had to wait for about 15 minutes to be seated as it was pretty busy. I had the spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza and found it be mostly Mexican beans and corn rather than the spicy chicken that I was expecting. I felt that that the Chipotle theme had been liberally extended to a more general Mexican theme which did not work for me. My friend had a pasta dish and said that it was bland to the extent of lacking any seasoning and I had to warn him from going overboard on the chili flakes that he was mixing in to help gulp it down. The server was friendly and service was fast considering how busy they were. Overall was not impressed and will not return in a hurry.

Monday night, my girlfriend and I were looking for quick bite before a concert at the Greek Theater.  We pulled up a couple seats at the bar and we were quickly greeted by the bartender, Dallas. We let him know we were in a hurry for the show and he helped guide us to some menu item that could quickly come out.  Through out the service he checked up on us and everything was very smooth.   Service was 5 stars.
Our California Club pizza was delicious..waiter Baldric was helpful and not pushy at all. Salted Caramel pudding also equally delicious and served in fun container...yum!
Williams was great! It was a very busy night but he still took care of us promptly and yes the food was great specially the moroccan-spiced chicken!

I really enjoyed my experience at this CPK location. The hosts were super friendly and even though there was a wait, they kept checking in with us to make sure we were up-to-date with what was going on at our table. I am a BBQ chicken salad aficionado and this one really was delicious. I wish i could have it for lunch every day. Our server was super friendly and professional. She knew I was in a time crunch and got my check out as fast as she good. I am only docking one-star because the food took about 5 minutes longer than it should have. Not my servers fault, though.
Seated immediately on my lunch break. Though hectic inside and out I received my 4 cheese ravioli shortly after ordering. It was great.

The service was just awful. We only saw our waiter a few times and had to ask different waiters for things several times just so we could get some help. We got our utensils and they had chocolate all over them. it took us a good 10 minutes just to get another set and we had to go through 3 people to finally get them. None of us plan to come back here again.
Great service, food good. Sat outside looking at the hollywood sign. Great place to eat b4 concert at Hollywood bowl, shuttle picks up at this mall.

Sometimes it is great to have family in town. You get to hang out with people that you haven't seen in a very long time, you get to show off the fabulous town you live in, and you get to have a reason to pig out. But unfortunately one of the downsides with tourists is sometimes they want to go places that you know suck - but you have to humor them. That was our experience here yesterday. Thankfully, my boyfriends aunt gave us gift cards so we had $30 to spend which wasn't ours. Our bill came to $7 after taking the gift cards into account and I guess that that isn't too bad.  Service was the same kind of service that you would expect when everyone assumes you are a tourist. Too bad I work in this mall, and my boyfriend lives a block away. We are rather snobbish in the whole "we're not tourists and therefore demand service" aspect of things. We were seated immediately but then it took a good ten minutes to even see the patio server. He was okay, not the best. He only really stopped at the table when delivering food and drinks. When he was taking our food order (we wanted a pizza done half and half) it seemed to confuse him.
