He forgot our bread. We all left the table under the general impression that he was stoned.  Everyone else split the pizza which was about $11. I had the Kung Pao spaghetti which was about $10, but then to add chicken was an extra $3. I always remember it being super delicious with chicken but when it came to the table it had about 3 chunks of chicken in it (it used to be strips) and was definitely not worth the "upgrade". It was also incredibly spicy. I mean - I understand this is a spicy dish but I feel this one was overly spiced. The portion was a good size - I had enough to share at the table and take home for late night drunken leftovers.  Overall - thank the pizza gods we had a gift card! I would have been pissed if I had to throw down any more than $5 for this meal.
Pizza was good but service was extremely horrible. No straws, no napkins or utensils. And no refills! Had to ask for everything to another server. Not planning on coming back to this place!
Had a really good pizza. The California Club, loved the mix of bacon with the fresh avocado and tossed salad.

I recommend ordering anything BUT the pizzas at CPK (super ironic). Seriously though, the pizzas I've tried are just too salty and the dough is not good at all. If you do want pizza, I've tried the Blanca flatbread which was better than their regular pizzas in my opinion. The BEST item on their menu is the chicken tequila fettuccini!! And the BBQ chicken salad is tasty as well! These two dishes alone make up for the higher rating.  Don't forget to get your parking validated (it will be $2 for 2 hrs) More like 3 and a half, but giving 4 stars only because of some good memories (went to cpk often freshman year of college because it was close enough to easily gather large groups).
Good food, awesome service, very reasonable prices for Hollywood. There is nothing you can't love.

Ssssssllllllllooooooowwwwwww service!. We sat at our table for over 15 minutes as servers, waiters, and even mangers passed by our table without even making eye contact much less take a drink order or tell us they would be right with us. We finally grabbed one of the waiters and asked who our server was. He said he didn't know but would take our order in a moment. I would be more understanding if they were really busy but they were not and 15+ minutes was ridiculous even if they were. The bad service continued with slow food arrival, and refills were none existent. The only thing that arrived in a timely manner was the check. The food at CPK is always consistently good so we didn't have a problem with that.

I have eaten here many,  many  times, I always bring tourists here as Hollywood and Highland is a great place for visitors...I have ALWAYS received GREAT service and GREAT food each and every time!! I had forgotten to get my parking receipt validated, and when I ran back even though they were closed the waitress came to the door took my ticket and validated it! Now THATS what I'm talking  about! GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

The staff here was really nice, especially our waitress. They brought us out free guacamole and chips because it was our first time there. I enjoyed the food a lot. Overall it was a really good experience and I would go back!
I love this place!!!! It's close to my house... I eating there evry day.. The people are nice and the pizza is amazing...

CPK isn't a bad chain restaurant. I've been here a few times with friends or coworkers even though I'd prefer dining at some other places located in the Hollywood/Highland center. I normally opt for their spring rolls, the tortilla soup, a salad, and perhaps a pizza. This location is tucked in the back. They have a great patio and plenty of seating inside. You'll find it near the Starbucks. Customer service is friendly and you'll find plenty to look at while dining. I like to people watch and gawk at the tourist as they attempt to get a photo of the Hollywood sign.  Other than that, it's just a great place to go if you need an old staple or a reliable chain to eat at.

I used to like coming to this place but I'm sad to say it's no longer good.  The service was horrible the waiter didn't come at all to ask if we needed anything so I had to wave him down,I asked for some red chilli peppers, and he said "ok I'll be right over with them" 15 minutes passed and with only two slices left of pizza I wanted him down again and asked him "what happened with the red chilli peppers?"his response "their being washed" .  The pizza we ordered didn't seem to have any cheese on it when the waiter saw it he also agreed and offered us a free kids size pizza with plenty of cheese on it.  Do I need to go on?

My coworkers and I decided to have lunch at CPK. We were greeted by a really friendly hostess only to be served by rude servers. All the servers were indifferent and seemed really unhappy. Next time, I think i'll order take out and eat it in the office.
Yummy food and clean bathroom.  We sat outside with a nice view of the Hollywood sign.   The server was really nice, but she took a while to refill my cranberry cooler.

i had a good experience here, but it was more because of the service than the food itself. our server was super nice, really gave us a run down of our options, and even offered me a refill on soup. the food itself was, well, 3 stars. the tortilla soup was good but certainly not the best i've ever had. the white pizza was the perfect size for 3 of us, but mediocre on taste. the garlic and bacon were about all i could taste. i'd go back. it's right for the price, and the experience is good. but i'd probably get something different. they do have a lot of options, so i'd recommend trying the place out for yourself.

Really nice bar service. We decided on lunch at the bar. It was actually comfortable even though we sat right next to the "Take out" counter part of the bar...during lunch. The chubby, strawberry blonde Queen who works at the bar is such a pleasure! He was so nice and always smiling! Loved him and he made our experience even better at CPK. My last experience at CPK in OC was just as nice. They really spend time on their training of their staff. Never a bad experience.

A+ for food. Mis padres really think CPK is better in California. The kung pao was spicier and the salad had more avocado than we'd get out east. Excellent white pizza--so delicious. We had a great time. Highly recommended if you want to shop/tour in the area--plus they validate your parking at the H&H lot. Our server was really nice too. Well, why did I take away two stars?? Smells and wait--I don't know why but the day we went there was a smell out front. And of course, they wanted to sit us there--but they did eventually let us move. Also we called ahead and we were told there was no wait, but when we got there--there was a long (at least 15-20 min) wait.
Our waiter Frankie was super accommodating. It was such an extremely hot day and he kept the drinks coming and even gave us a to go cup!!! Wonderful! Thanks Frankie

Poor customer service. One employee told me they do deliver waited on hold for 10mins to be transfer to someone that told me they don't deliver, even when the recording & live person said they did. Went in & the manager couldn't even give me a straight answer as to why I was told two different things & didn't even tell me if they deliver or not! How don't you know?? Seriously your the manager! Crazy! Smh. How do these people get hired ?

Stopped in to have a late lunch. Was greeted right away as we approached the check in booth, I requested to be seated on the patio and was immediately walked to our table. The host was quick to re-clean the table for us as we sat down. Our server, Victoria was friendly, upbeat, polite and kept us well taken care of. The patio was checked regularly and cleaned as each table was cleared. Not sure about the interior as we did not go inside but the outside was clean and well maintained. The food came out fresh and hot and was delicious. I ordered the Thai pizza and the baby ordered crispy chicken and broccoli and we both loved our dishes. Great spot to enjoy the breeze and a great meal.

I come here every Friday . Every single time I come here with my friends , we receive the best customer service . Everyone in this staff goes beyond in excellent customer service . I'm not into chain restaurants but I come here for convenience. I keep coming here because the food is always good & the staff here rocks ! As I'm sitting here I decided they deserve an awesome review . You could tell the manager here must treat there staff right . Thanks for the excellent customer service !

I've been to this location twice now and I have been pleased with my experience.   Both visits were in the afternoon at slightly off dining times (around 2pm), but we were promptly seated and greeted by an efficient server. The food has been fresh and delicious.  I am a big fan of the pizza and my husband likes the full size salads.  I would recommend visiting, especially if you don't have a California Pizza Kitchen in your area.

I've always loved CPK in florida so decided to try it while I was visiting dolby theater in Hollywood. I was not disappointed! Very good service and food. Love the atmosphere on the patio overlooking the Hollywood sign

Came in here yesterday with my family and my service dog. The Hispanic hostess in the front demanded to see an ID for my dog. My dog had a service vest on that we purchased, although everyone knows there's really no proper identification or vest required. We told her we didn't have one because we aren't required to show that by law. I understand that maybe because she's unfamiliar with how the system works, she could refuse to seat us inside. What bothered me the most was the fact that she and her coworkers were pointing fingers and snickering at us. If you don't know proper law, educate yourself. Even if we were in the wrong, we are still customers and don't deserve to be treated like that

Came, expecting good things. No lag on seating time. :D Hostess seemed angry to see us. D: Server brought us no bread D: Server took 25 minutes to get to us. Normally would be fine if rush time, but this woman was genuinely doing her best to ignore us, it seemed. Maybe she had other stuff going on, but still a negative D: Food was also slightly disappointing: Mac and Cheese Balls were cold by the time they got to us, another 30 minutes after we ordered. Not particularly busy at any point tonight, mind you. D: Salad was good. :D BBQ chicken pizza had no corn. I am disappointed. D:

For the record I love CPK but I am done with this location. I've given them at least a dozen chances and each time I order and go pick up or get delivery something is missing or the order is completely wrong. So tonight I placed my order at 6:45 and it's 9:35 and I still haven't eaten. It took 2 hours to deliver me something I didn't even order and now I'm waiting for what I did order. I'm just done with you. Done.

CPK, is another place that for me, is consistently inconsistent. I can have an awesome experience one day, then an absolutely awful one on my very next visit. It's not just the service, but the food quality and it's something I don't understand, seeing as CPK is a chain, and consistency is something that should be standard, no matter what the location is.  I understand service can be hit or miss because sometimes people are just off. However, in this case, it must have been staff shortage because for some reason, our server had a very large station and several large parties. That left me and my friends constantly looking around for her, or for anyone for that matter - for service.  I don't know if the food quality is on me - or the chefs, as I didn't like my dish at all. I decided to try the Kung Pao Spaghetti and not only was it bland, there was no reason for the words 'Kung Pao' in the name because it wasn't spicy at all either. I'm sure it didn't help that I had just gotten back from China and was hoping for something more authentic and flavorful as the foods I enjoyed while there.  Anyway, my friends were equally unhappy with the experience but if history plays out - the next time I dine at a CPK, everything should be ok, at the least if not great.

Three stars indeed. Chain restaurants like this are why other countries laugh at us. That said, the food isn't half-bad if you have unadventurous friends who like the consistency (yawn) of a mainstream chain restaurant. It's fine. Just fine. No more than fine. But fine.
Stable neighborhood Italian. Like the petite wedge, Thai chicken pizza & cedar plank salmon
Going to a good restaurant is good but having an awesome waiter is better! Big kudos to Abbie, our waiter she made us feel right at home !

This location at Hollywood and Highland is located right next to the Starbucks in the back.  They must have changed their menu because I was looking forward to ordering a specific dish and it wasn't on it.  Oh well.  My dining companion and I decided to split a half salad and a pizza.  We opted for the Moroccan spiced chicken salad and the 5-cheese and tomato pizza.  We also ordered a red sangria and a Newcastle beer.  The drinks arrived first, followed by the salad and pizza.  Our server also brought us some plates to divide up the food.  The salad was really good.  It had dates, dried cranberries, spiced chicken, beets, bell pepper, spring mix lettuce, almonds, avocado, chopped eggs and butternut squash.  It was one heck of a salad.  It was really tasty and I really enjoyed all of the different textures.  I really enjoyed the sweet and the savory combinations too.  The salad gets 4 stars in my book.   The pizza was cooling as we ate our salad.  It was delightful but nothing special.  3 stars.  Our service was great, as we arrived when it wasn't too busy.  The host seated us on the patio as requested, and we enjoyed the warm LA weather.  Luckily the restaurant was in the shade or else we would have asked to be seated inside.  This is a solid place to eat at with large groups because there is something for everyone.
Excellent Crunchy  Thai Salad. Ordered a medium rare Rib eye, but it cam med well. Still very good flavor,  just a little dry.

We decided to dine at CPK before the Hollywood Bowl concert. I had the chicken piccatta while my husband ordered the Salmon. We also ordered soup: baked potato. The soup was good. The entrees were delicious. The waiter was nice and attentive to our needs. We will definitely return soon.
We were seated immediately. It was 9 o'clock on a Friday evening. Dylan was our server and he was on top of things the whole way. The food was great! Very happy with our experience.
Horrible service. We usually love cpk and the menu options but this location has the worst service.  Rude.

The restaurant is located in the Hollywood and Highland shopping centre; perfect spot to take a photo of the Hollywood sign on level 4. Unfortunately at night time it was not lit up. The service was great, the lady who looked after our table was amazing, polite, helpful and made sure the whole family is ok. I bought the Salmon, it was over clocked and without skin. The corn and capsicum were nice.. Over all it was an enjoyable main. My daughter bought the crunchy Thai salad, She liked it and I liked the taste. The kids had macaroni and cheese.. Was nice too. The over all experience was satisfactory.

Food was okay went during lunch time and our server was just not friendly. It was our first time there and our host said we could get something free I forgot what she said. But our server didn't mention anything. Overall food was mediocre. View from outside was gorgeous can see the Hollywood sign.

I LOVE California Pizza Kitchen, but this specific location has the most awful service ever. My boyfriend and I decided to do take-out since we thought it'd be faster than sit-down. We waited at the Take Out station for maybe 10 minutes before anyone actually talked to us. But as I looked around there were a couple of servers standing at a table, talking and doing nothing, which really annoyed me. The bartender finally took our order and we waited maybe about 45 minutes for our food...and I just ordered pasta! My boyfriend's pizza finished 15 minutes before mine actually finished. We should've just stayed there to eat! It was ridiculous. Also, the people next to us complained about their food as well. Their chicken was cold and they forgot grapes for his salad. Clearly this specific CPK does not live up to the standards of the others.
Said they took my takeout order but had no record of it when I arrived to pick it up.

Great location, great people watching (even though they'll probably be tourists).  The food is exactly the same as you'd get in any other CPK, so I'm not going to go on and on.  I always order the same thing: California Club with chicken and extra lettuce.  Be sure to have CPK validate your parking ticket.

The server that we had was great he was attentive even though it was a busy Friday night. But the food was awful. Over the years the quality of CPK has declined, ever since they started selling frozen pizza in the grocery store it all tastes manufactured.

ooo how do i love thee cpk. I hate the mall you're in but i love thee still! Went last night before catching a movie and well to be honest I haven't been to cpk for a bit. Ordered the avocado roll mmm nyam nyam. the dipping sauce was awesome as well... but i have a weird thing for avocado.. so lets just leave it like that. I ordered the baby clam linguini w/ cream sauce. HIGH FIVE it's usually good but this is the first time I've had it at this location. I usually go to burbank cause they do an awesome job there. It was a bit dry this time.. but all the flavors was there hence only -1 star. Splitted the 5 cheese w/ fresh tomatoes pizza. ALL I CAN SAY YOU MUST GET IT AND ROLL YOUR TOUNGE WITH THE TOMATO!! the flavor is sweet. if you just munch on it, it tastes like any other pizza but if you let the tomato sit on your tounge the flavors.. omg the flavors! i kid you not! the tiramisu.. i love tiramisu. i love it ALOT. if tiramisu was a person i would be hugging it and drolling all over it right now! (ok that didn't come out right but you get the point) It was nice to see a change to it with the mocha cream they poured over it.. the peach italian soda.. was hmm.. beautiful made me almost want to cry. heheh free refills... so i ended up getting like 4 refills. yes i love italian soda and if you have problem then go suck it up. last but not least. our waitress. SHE WAS FRIKKIN AWESOME!

Food is mediocre. Nothing outstanding but still nothing horrible. You would think the pizza to be tastier than their salads but today was not the case.  We waited fifteen minutes to get a table with several tables that would have seated our party easily in view. The hostess of the evening looked bored out of her mind and treated us with a level of disdain. Her tone was rude, sarcastic, and incredibly unappreciated.  Our waiter was polite enough but paid more attention to those around us. I might just be slightly put out, but who has a ten minute conversation about the quality of their arugula when you have other tables needing waiting on? Overall, I doubt a return will be in order.  Oh. On the bright side though the manager was quite friendly when she seated us because the hostess failed to do so.

I'm pretty pissed about the changes to the menu, CPK. You removed the dynamite shrimp, best appetizer ever, and the broccoli sundried tomato fusilli, which was my favorite pasta dish. I think you're trying to be "healthier" or something, but it's really just depressing. But... I have to admit that I do like some of the new menu items, and the strawberry basil martini is the perfect summer drink: delicious and refreshing. As far as this location goes, even being in the tourist mecca of Los Angeles, it is a gem. The staff is all incredibly friendly and personable, and service is downright excellent. So if you still like the menu, you'll want to come to this restaurant. It may be one of the only reliable ones left at Hollywood and Highland.

i honestly thought it was goin to be good but sadly my order was missing stuff . it defenitly wasn't worth what i payed & i couldnt go bck because of my break time. i thought it was goin to be better but no. not ordering food from here anymoree

I have been here twice, once in 2007 and again in 2013. The location is perfect for tourists or for those passing through the Hollywood & Highland area. The food is good and there is a big selection, you can always get something different and delicious. There are great vegetarian options, which is nice. The service and atmosphere were both great. I like sitting outside and enjoying the LA weather. It's a prime people-watching location.

Great service and Great food! Our waiter Johnny was very attentive and gave us great recommendations from the menu! It seemed he geniuenly cared about us having a great experience and taste for the food. We had a small snafu, but the manager made it right.. Would Definetly go back.
As usual, amazing pizza.  Little advice, if you are not doing a simple pick up and want to sit then you better make a reservation!

The service was GREAT! the best I think i've had. the guy was so nice: he said we were his only table so we would get a lot of attention, and we were laughing cause we would just look his way and he was THERE HELPING US immediately. Really cool guy.  The pizza: What? D'jiorno's is better. lol. It wasn't hot, wasn't crisp, wasn't anything...just a little pizza for over $10. I wasn't impressed. Salad: I had some pear and nut salad, I LOVE salad and this one was great.  A little overpriced but what do you expect for Hollywood and Highland?

I love CPK so just know that this is a biased opinion lol... disclosure for you...  I plan to write about every CPK and my opinion on its individual service and location.  As for this one at Hollywood and Highland, I like the environment of it... It has a great outdoor area where you can sit, eat, and watch all the unique people passing by. Whether its a large group of tourists on a tour, or just normal tourist snapping pics, or weird guys in Spider Man outfits... Life is different when your at Hollywood & Highland...  Service and food was great as usual and I never have complaints... and everyone should try the Chicken Caesar Salad and the Napoleon Pizzas...  Give it a shot...

BBQ chicken pizza. Do i need to even say anymore in this review?? Okay. Mango Iced Tea. Convinced yet? The crappy side? it's in Highland at Hollywood, which can mean tons and tons of nightmarish traffic and pedestrians.

This is a good place to eat if you're in the Hollywood & Highland area. We sat outside and a nice view of the Hollywood sign, which is always nice. It's located in the Hollywood & Highland mall, which is a gigantic 5 or 6 story shopping Mecca. Plenty of stores, food and Hollywood imitators outside. The walk of fame lines the sidewalks, and with in walking distance is Grauman's Chinese Theater. Oh, yea, the food :) My better half had a personal pizza, pepperoni and sausage which was pretty good. I have a pasta, spicy chipotle fettuccine with chi cken, was delicious also. We started off with a quesadilla which could possibly be the world's smallest quesadilla, but for $5, couldn't have expected that much, right? Ambiance is lively, so be ready for some noise. We sat outside, which was enjoyable.

CPK is very consistent and there when you need it.  It's not the best pizza, but it is a healthier option as they don't overwhelm you with the cheese and are not greasy.  I love that they have whole wheat honey crust which is tasty.  Try their soups.... the Chicken Tortilla is always good, and they have a new soup Tuscan White Bean minestrone which was pretty good.  Ask for a sample to see if you like it. This location is great and a better option than the food court upstairs at H&H.  The staff at this location were excellent.

I have always loved CPK, so when I moved and found out that there was one so close to my job I was pumped. I have found in Los Angeles that there are almost TOO MANY choices when it comes to just about everything, and some days I am just so exhausted at the thought of having to decide where to eat that I skip meals all together - enter California Pizza Kitchen. CPK is my go-to when I just don't know where to go to. With such a large menu, there is always something I want to eat. My absolute favorites are their chopped salad, white pizza, and mac-n-cheese. The thing about their mac-n-cheese is that you can order the kids' size and it is still HUGE and will only run you like $6! I always add grilled chicken pieces, so it ups the price to about $9, but still you can't beat a whole meal for less than $10 that is NOT fast food. The Hollywood/Highland location is obviously in a busy location, but I have never experienced a wait. I have done take-out on multiple occasions, as well as eaten at the bar and every time I am there the servers are attentive, the food is delicious, and everything is done in a timely manner. I think one of the things that makes California Pizza Kitchen so awesome is that is reliably fantastic. I have never had a bad meal or bad experience and will definitely be continuing my patronage of this great chain and this awesome location!

My family and I went to CPK after the performance of the Nutcracker. It was very busy, but our waiter(sorry forgot your name) was amazing!!! We had a party of 8 and they treated us like we were the only ones there. The food came out hot and delicious!! The drinks were cold and spot on! What a great experience!!  Thank you for making the night even more amazing!!!
Ordered Chicken Tequila Fet. Hoping it's gonna be good The food is alright... not very happy

Me & my crew come to this CPK location A LOT. One of the best places near the school. The service is cool, they're nice & they're fast.. It's usually crowded if you come anywhere from 12-2. It's kinda hard to find but it's on the top floor of the plaza. We all usually get the Jaimican Jerk Chicken, oh man, it's SOO good..

We waited over 30 minutes for a take away pizza to be told that the salad toppings have been left off for us to put on there ourselves. So it took half an hour to cook a pizza with some cheese on it. The pizza tasted pretty bland as the ingredients hadn't been cooked together. What a joke!

So we decided to have a nice birthday lunch for my brother. So far my experience has been horrible. Our waiter tintin does not care to give us attention what so ever. Another waiter had to get our drink order. Then we waited awhile for tin tin to get our food orders. We asked for bread, took awhile for that to get to our table. We asked again if the bread was coming and he said it's being freshly baked but when it got to our table it was cold and chewy. Pretty sure it wasn't fresh. I will be never returning to this location ever again.

I have been going to CPK since i was little and i used to love it! But since 2007, the quality of the food and the portions have diminished. I have never seen a restaurant cut so many corners. I ordered chips and guacamole to go and the guacamole was so small, filled with mostly cheap corn and other fillers. It didn't even taste like avocado. FILLER FOOD: that's what you can expect now at CPK. And of course they're always trying to push the drinks on you because that's how they make the bulk of their money. Cheap booze mixed with cheap filler sugary liquids. You've disappointed me, CPK! Two stars only because the place seems clean

I've had nothing but average to below average experiences at CPK. This visit was no exception. We ordered all kinds of stuff such as the Spicy Chipotle Pizza, the White, and the Five Cheese. All of them came out tasting like you'd expect from CPK, strange and kind of hard to wrap your taste buds around. Maybe my pallet isn't sophisticated enough for god awful toppings on pizza, but hey, that's just me, maybe you'll like their new pizza that's coming out. It's called singing on the toilet, because trust me, after a night at CPK, that's all your ass is going to be doing.
We went here for lunch and when they gave us our plates they were not washed or clean.  The plate still had leftovers from a previous visit on them.

At CPK at bar and ginger bearded Curtis and Cameron are running rings around pig and whistle on service and personality!  Yes I know it's a chain. Yes I know you can get it anywhere else in the city. But here you get it really really good! Having chicken lettuce cups and strawberry basil martinis. Now it's on.....

Four stars, but only because our server was kick-ass as both a server and a salesman.  No server has even been able to talk my husband into ordering dessert, and to this guy's credit - not only did we order dessert, it was actually delish.  Freakishly delish. Food is like any other CPK (not shabby), prices are higher than other pizza places (again, like any other CPK), and this place can get busy since it's located at H&H.  Still, they have quite a bit of seating, and they seem to get the food out pretty quickly.   Yay!

The bf and I were hungry and we live a block away. I thought hey I've been to Cpk a million times so it's a safe bet.  Wrong  We ordered the spinach and artichoke pizza from our waiter and asked to add tomato and chicken. We figured a salad to start would satisfy us in the mean time so we ordered the Ceaser.  About fifteen minutes had passed and the waiter came out with our Ceaser salad... Literally one minute later the pizza came without the tomatoes and we had to ask for our Parmesan and red peppers... I dunno I thought that was weird considering it's Cpk and we ordered a pizza.  Sooo then I bit into the pizza and stopped after two bites. Literally whole chunks of artichokes and full on spinach slapped on some pizza dough. I thought maybe it would be like a spinach and artichoke dip/sauce... Wrong huge disappointment. I love spinach and artichoke dip, but not spinach and artichoke on bread with no flavor. Two thumbs down on this experience but I'll be back to give another try and another review.

At least the lemonade is good?  The service was great. Our server was really nice, but the food was just crap. I don't know. I still crave CPK, but I'm going to have to kill that craving with the frozen pizzas at the market instead.

I did not want to come here, considering this was my first trip to Hollywood. However, my friends had already been drinking and just wanted to get some decent food that was convenient. This CPK was adjacent to our hotel so it was at the very least not a hassle. We got there and already knew it was going to be a silly evening. We teased the man who seated us into giving us crayons and children's menus, and our waitress gave us hell for them for the entirety of the meal. We ordered some shrimp appetizer, my friends got salads, and I got the BBQ chicken pizza. The salads were delicious, but I thought the shrimp dish was pretty bland. My pizza was decent, though I've had better at other CPKs. I'd say the food was what you would expect - good, but not great. The best part of our meal was definitely just being playful with the servers and having a good time. They even let us take our open bottle of wine home with us. If you're from the area and don't care if you eat at a chain, this CPK is fine. I wouldn't come here as a visitor though. There are too many other, local options.

I liked it. Service was good.  Food was typical CPK food.  BBQ Chicken Pizza was delicious as usual.  The smoothies are just alright.  Not too sweet.  Nothing really more I can say about this place. Make sure to validate your parking ticket.  The machine is inside in the waiting area.

3.5! I love CPK amongst the ranks of chain restaurants! They offer a great reward program for returning customers. The prices are a little high, but the food is decent. I had the BBQ chicken pizza. I enjoyed every bite! Service was as good as expected. There is nothing special enough about CPK to give it 4 stars!

Went here recently with family and was impressed as usual by the food and service.  I am not a pizza fan usually.  Mainly because they are greasy and my tummy is not a fan of that but no one makes a BBQ chicken pizza like CPK.  It is rich in BBQ sauce, chicken is tender and a nice mix of cheese.  I take out the cilantro though cause I don't like it, the red onions are even good.   Over all for the money and the food, plus good service, I am satisfied.

Location (1 star)- Right in the heart of Hollywood and Highlands. Parking sucks unless you get validated or pay the steep $15 parking. Ehh. Still theres so much to do in here so its worth it. Food (1 star)-  Pesto Cream Penne- Pesto cream sauce, sun-dried tomatoes and Parmesan. Also available with chicken, shrimp or chicken & shrimp. Good portion. Sooooo good. Love their pastas Chinese Chicken Salad- Napa & red cabbage, lettuce and wontons tossed with carrots, scallions, sesame seeds and cilantro in a sweet & sour dressing. Topped with chicken. Yum! The portion is actually pretty large. Don't order too much. They give you free bread.  Customer Service (1 star)- We sat at the bar. Bartender guy was really nice. He was really nice. Checked up on us pretty often.  Ambiance (.5 stars)- Not really a "date" kind of ambiance. Better for casual dining with girlfriends. Overall experience (.5 stars)- When I think about having dinner, I don't think CPK. Especially since this place is somewhat unexcessable. I would only go here just because I am already here.

Good food and our waiter was nice but the hostess with the big hoop earrings was just rude and tried to be snarky in a slick way. It was our first time at the restaurant and we were not sure if we had to seat ourselves or wait. Every where's different. So after waiting a couple minutes outside, we went inside to check and the hostess came up and got mad at us for walking in. We understand that there is only "one of her", as she said herself, but in no way were we trying to be rude or be a pain. We just were not sure how the seating went. It's crazy how one bad attitude can affect the entire meal especially when we were not rude towards her once. She was the first one to come off that way.

I've now been to this location twice. Both times were actually great. I would have expected this location to be busier considering its location. However the first time the wait wasn't that long and then more recently my friends and I got in without any wait at all. The service was quick and efficient and the waiter was definitely on top of his game. The Tostada pizza is by far the most unique pizza I've had from CPK, but it was so delicious. I'd definitely recommend it. And you can't beat CPK's pricing. The pizzas are big enough to adequately fill you up and very few of them are over $13. With the complementary bread and a glass of water you have yourself a cheap and delicious meal. I'd definitely recommend checking out this location.

The guy manning the take-out corner's name is Raccoon. RACCOON, people. He has Elvis-style sideburns, he never forgets to throw extra bread & utensils in my bag, never forgets to put extra lime cream sauce on the side when I order the chipotle chicken pizza, never forgets that I work in the complex & therefore get a nominal discount... He's awesome. How can he NOT be awesome when his name is RACCOON???!!?!  Two Thumbs Up!

This CPK seemed weird.  I really don't know how to describe it.  Maybe it was the weird clientele that ate there that day or that the staff seemed distracted.  IDK what it was.    As far as the food CPK is great!  I always get the same thing, Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza and an Iced Tea.  This CPK wouldn't be my first location of choice because of the touristy area and the fact that the Hollywood/Highland shopping center has really nothing to offer locals. We all know this area is geared towards the tourists. All in all it was okay. On a side note....if you're a basketball fan (like me)....I did see Alonzo Mourning eating lunch w/ his family.

If I can give this place a zero I would totally do it I have gone multiple  times expecting CPK to redeem themselves and every time I go in either the pasta is hard and I have to send it back or the pizza has the wrong ingredients it always something wrong when I come here. I seriously like the good CPK has to offer but at this location it's a horrible dining experience. Don't come here it's a disappointment to the CPK brand

We were recommended to go to this place and eat their amazing pizzas. Big flop. I do not even know why they have such weird pizzas. We took Thai pizza and one with avocado and bacon. Thai pizza was disgusting. Friendly staff, however, who constantly refilling your drinks.

Weak. Eaten here only a few times over the years. Salads were the same every time - chopped, tossed with too much dressing, tastes like something I imagine you'd get at a Crapplebee's or IwishitwasSaturday's. Same with pizzas - topping and cheese are okay but the dough is half baked: not brown, not golden, just beige and soft (not to be confused with dough-y.) Nine at night, your oven should be hot by now, right? That's just how they think pizza is supposed to be, I guess. Oven needs to be hotter on top and bottom. The dough reminded me of the  only time I ever had Little Caesar's pizza. I was at Kmart, famished, grabbed a slice out of desperation. It was junk pizza. Not saying CPK is junk pizza, but the dough (calling it "crust" is a misnomer here) is like that: bleh.  Service is good. Patio chairs are a laugh: miniature, wicker, bucket seats, sized for a child. Actually, they had to have been designed to hold a doll or a lawn elf or some other inanimate object. I'm 5'9", average weight - this chair was like sitting on a tiny, twisted, wicker-wrapped jungle gym embedded with warped, cement skeeballs. I sat down, stood right back up and requested a new chair. I puzzled as I looked around and saw other patrons contentedly squashed into these atrocities: they must've been either too afraid to speak up, in a state of shock, pain, or denial, or, most likely, they were experiencing cognitive dissonance, reasoning that it is impossible that a restaurant would furnish itself with this torturous seating device and highly improbable that such an uncomfortable chair would be designed and manufactured to begin with. Therefore - they convinced themselves - they were enjoying a perfectly reasonable, average or better, level of seating comfort. If anything, I recommend going there and sitting in a patio chair. You will never experience anything like it anywhere else. p.s. I don't like it when people from the business respond to my review with some lame appeal, but of all the 1 and 2 star reviews (there are LOTS AND LOTS) - why respond to just *one*? Is the guy a food critic or something?   Weak.
I like this location a lot.  For being so central on Hollywood Blvd, it was accessible, we hardly had a wait, and the white pizza was delicious.

We waited a while before anyone came to our table to ask us for drinks or our order, however after they realized we had been waiting they made sure to take extra care of us. They brought us a free appetizer and checked on us often. Everyone was over the top nice and polite. Despite the wait in the beginning I would recommend this place to others and I will come here again.

I work near this one and we're always ordering catering and having lunch here. The service is always good and the staff is always friendly, which for a location that is in the middle of a tourist area, that's something to say.  I love the redo of their menu and the small bites. I've gone through phases at CPK and am currently a fan of their Chicken Panini sandwiches paired with a soup or salad. This is one of the only places where I will repeat the same order twice. And that's usually because it's good.
Met a friend for lunch, busy busy busy...but we got right in, they move things along! The service was great and the food was really good. They have indoor and outdoor seating.

Never again! My boss is a very generous person, and on a Thursday afternoon he decided to treat the office (of about 11 people) to Pizza and other entrees from this CPK. He got 2 small 10 inch pizza's 3 salads, a Caesar Sandwitch w/ soup and a Pesto Penne. ......the amount that food that came was an absolute joke! The sandwich wasn't seasoned.....the Soup came in a 10 ounce to-go soup cup and was less than 1/2 full!!  The charge? $120.16??? Are you crazy?  We can choose from one of many local Mom and Pop Pizzerias and get a lot more and much tastier food than this for HALF the price. A Total rip off!!! STAY AWAY from CPK!!
Food was good service was a little separator an the server wasn't that attentive. Wanted dessert and she never came back after dropping bill.

Good selection and food. The ambiance is pretty basic, but nice and open. The current special that the CPK's have called the Korean BBQ pizza is actually really, really good, but it's not exactly Korean. They cook the marinated beef into the pizza and then top it all with their own fresh version of kimchi. They use cilantro, which is not Korean at all, and because of this, if you ask for them to make it spicy, it will come out tasting exactly like Vietnamese bahn mi. IT"S AWESOME! They should just put some fresh jalapenos on the thing and call it the Bahn Mi Pie or something.

Boring food lackluster serivce.  After we are seated and water is placed the waitress doesn't even place new cutlery, there was one set on the table for 4 of us. After we ordered the food came and no paper towels or cutlery. The pizzas were boring, Pizza hut makes way better pizzas at way better price than these people. I remember eating in a CPK in Minneapolis and that had varied menu options and great tasting food  This CPK in Hollywood was horrible for 12-14 that they charge per pizza all you get is a soggy looking medium size pizza that doesnt even taste good. This is the last time I'll ever take anybody to a CPK ever!

Wait times were horrendous. We ordered three cheese ravioli, Jamaican thin crust pizza and another thin crust with artichokes. Everything was just okay. Nothing extraordinary. Oh and did I say the wait times were horrendous??

I'm a huge cpk fan for over 15 years. Been to almost every location from Manhattan Beach (corporate account regular) and all OC, LA/Valley areas. Dine in and curbside pick up. Practically memorize the menu.  We were debating on driving to Umami Burger or CPK (after seeing a show at El capitan) We chose cpk since it was family friendly. The hostess with short dark hair said it'll be 25min wait, so we decided to stay. After 30min, she told us it'll be another 10-15.hmmm...since we already waited, we decided to stay. Then after 1hour, she said "you're next right after this other group".  waiting... still not being seated and noticing tons of people being called.  So I politely asked the hostess again, what's going on, we've waited well over an hour and she said "the time I gave you was just an estimate". Then I said, that I noticed several people that came after us, being called up and she said (with a slight attitude) that they are being called because they had a smaller table.  (tables of 4, 5, 6 adults i don't think is fair to be seated first!) We were 4 adults, 2 babies (both 2 yr -not in highchairs) and an infant 6months.   I do think she forgot about us, because she had too look at the OTHER paper, for our names. Or perhaps, she wasn't paying attention to who was arrived early or not. I saw tables, that could've fit our party. I was pissed and wanted to leave, but everyone was just hungry and didn't feel like driving/waiting again elsewhere.  Finally they sat us after 1hour and 35min. (in the meantime a party of 3 who arrived AFTER us, already ate and was leaving) My friend told the other male hostess about our wait, and he got the manager, who was very apologetic and comped 2 small appetizers which came out quickly.  However, with babies, time is more valuable. If the hostess told us 45min wait in advance, we would've gone elsewhere.  They labeled us as a table of 7 AND included the automatic gratuity for a large party. (the infant doesn't even eat solids) and the toddlers just ate 1 pizza crust each and boxed the rest. Ironically, after all the wait, we weren't even seated at 1 table! Our hubbies sat in a separate booth across our booth. And the "stroller" which she added as the 7th person, had to be left in the front. (she also did not mention we couldn't take the stroller to the table even though i told her we had a stroller) We tried to make the best of the night. Food tasted as expected, although the pasta was tad more al dente. The star is for the nice manager comp, and our server was attentive and nice. Otherwise, never again here at this location.
We get CPK for delivery.   Since we don't get the service or ambiance, I'm just rating the food.  Let's just say that there is so many other better pizza places.

What can I say, I know I was on vacation & I've been to CPK a million times before in Miami but after touring almost all of LA in one day & famished at the end of the night, CPK was conveniently next to our hotel. There was a waiting line so we decided to sit & eat at the bar (same service people). Our bartender was amazing & took care of us right away. We ordered the California Club pizza with the Spaghetti Bolognese and both plates were to die for. Granted, we were at the point of starvation but all in all, it was exactly what we needed! I'd definitely recommend both to try next time.

Our family recently ate at this CPK on a trip to Graumens Chinese Theater and could not have been any happier with the service and food. The manager and server went out of their way to find anchovies for a pizza that we ordered. The BEST CPK we have ever been to and by far the best staff our family had the pleasure to order from!!! These are great people!

Came here to eat lunch after a movie. I have a 4 year old child so I am big on the fast service. Which it wasn't. I sat there for about 5 mins or so without being helped. I didn't want to be "that table" who complained. I also know that Im not the only person on the face of the planet so of course I had to wait. The server did show up and we ordered. I got the Chinese Chicken salad. I order a full and thought it would be bigger, however it was enough for two dinners. And it was so yummy, my little me got the cheese pizza from the kids menu and we both loved it. Some of the best pizza ever. I tipped the waitress 20 percent and although I didn't see much of her, she was ok.  My only complaint was they only give you bread if you ask for it. I forgot to ask for bread and my sadly my server only came out to check on us after the food was dropped up.
Dont ever come here.  Good place for kids but service sucks.  Waiting here 20 mins not busy, they put all the new tables with one server.  Dont come here

We sat at a table on our own and within a few seconds a waiter came to our table and brought us menus. We got our two drinks and appetizers came fairly quickly. I got the baja chicken spring rolls with guacamole on the side and they were absolutely delicious. I wasn't prepared for how great the pizza was going to be. My boyfriend and I got our pizzas shortly after appetizers. He ordered the California Club Pizza and I ordered the Pepperoni Supremo. I haven't said OMG so many times in a row in my entire life. The California Club pizza was like something sent from a god's loins. I can't say enough good things about it and the Pepperoni Supremo was better than most pizzas in NY. I loved it here and I can't wait to find one in NY. Carlito was also a great waiter. Kept telling us to "take our time" even as we were heading out the door. I guess it's just a tick he has.

i dont remember the last time i was at cpk. i do know that it's been at least 3 years.  however, CPK honors veterans by offering them a free pizza & unalcoholic beverage for Veterans day so i just had to take them up on that offer (8.5 years Navy, active duty.) an air force vet of mine came along too, as well as some non vet friends (free pizza all around!)  i ordered the white pizza and friend ordered the spicy chipotle or something like that. the chipotle ended up being better than the white pizza.  the dinner was a pleasurable experience with nice staff all around. the service our smile from our waitress didnt go away once she realized that pretty much all 5 of us were eating for free. we ended up buying the pumpkin pie cheesecake just to have something to pay. our total was -35 + 7 so that was awesome and of course we tipped the full amount.

Came here to eat and was pleasantly surprised. I've passed by many of these restaurants but never felt the urge to ever go inside. Some one made the suggestion and voila I googled the menu and said what the hay. I called to see if they could accomodate 18 people and although they said they didn't take reservations they advised me to call an hour before wanting to be seated and let them know so they would be prepared. They said as long as were were there by 11 in the evening we would be fine. We arrived at the place and let the hostess know we were there. She was very nice and told us it would be just a minute. We were seated just a few minutes after we arrived. We ordered a bunch of appetizers, pizzas, and drinks. Even with 18 people the hostess was pleasant and attentive.  The food was very good. Pizzas and drinks, but the thing that will make me go back are the appetizers. The avacado club and sonora egg rolls are to die for. Delicious!!!!!  Very good place to go and this place in particular was good because they are used to lots of people. Very touristy location. Parking is convenient in the complex and it's close to many hotels right in the heart of Hollywood and Highland.

Random things I like about CPK:  - There's one in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. - They have a calorie count on the menus. ...and there you go. For this location, service is good. They seem to work well with large groups, so it's a good option for work lunches if your office is around H&H. If you're stuck, just get the tried-and-true BBQ Chicken Pizza. It's as safe a bet as anything you'll get anywhere.
Amazing salads and fresh ingredients. If you don't mind the tourists walking around. The food is definitely worth! Caramelized peach salad and lettuce wraps were delicious!

One of my favorite restaurants in general. I love all the unique pizza's that they have. But my experience only made it better. The service was great, the waitress was very attentive, had a great attitude and just made the whole experience that much more enjoyable.  I had the Santa Fe Chicken Pizza, which was very tasty. And my friend had something, but it was good,lol. The service time was also pretty quick and still all very tasty. I would definitely recommend that you guys check this spot out if you haven't already.

Service is good and food is good.  CPK is always a "safe bet" and I like some of their newer menu items.  The shrimp and zucchini fettuccini is a tasty lower calorie substitute for someone like me who enjoys the tequila chicken.  The arugula and asparagus salad is also one of my favorites; I do wish they would provide it in a meal size portion.  They also make a very good chopped salad.

Ok, for any newbie who is not familiar with the food, then this is not the review for you. What this is is a review of the service.  Bar none I have never had a more accommodating and eager to please dining experience with friends than at the Hollywood CPK, as we just showed up irritated and hungry, eager to see Tron at the El Capitan (with screaming kids!). The staff was made aware of our time issue, got our orders placed as they were setting up the table for us (in a HOLIDAY CROWD) and got us well fed and out the door with yummy doggie bags and holiday treats for the little (and not so little) ones. In about the same time it would have taken some less caring outfit to just sit us down to eat, we were already on our merry way.  It's one thing of one of the group feels that we should go back and tip them extra for the excellent service, it's another when it's unanimous and practically unspoken. Which itself was a good idea, as we had a more relaxed time to enjoy desserts (and waited out traffic) and then let the kids run loose around the fountain in the quad and play "Tron" until they wore themselves out. A nice long quiet drive home with everyone getting the most out of the evening. The staff was REALLY nice, like being back in high school with your classmates who worked at the favorite hang out. We had such a great time. Please be good to the staff there and they will be good to you as well.  About dessert:  White Chocolate Strawberry Cheesecake. In this point in my life nothing captured so many different meanings that the holiday season means to me now than that little slice of heaven. Well earned kudos! p.s. As anyone in Hollywood knows, parking is a pain. Plan ahead.

Dude...WTF? The server...was a douche! Me:  "what is your favorite thing to eat here?" server: "Uh, I dont eat here, I am on a diet." Me: "Uh ok...Ill get the blah blah blah pizza then." server: "It s better with steak." Me: "oh, you like it with steak?" server: "I never tried it." Me in my head..."WHAT THE F:LU_)(*_)(@"???" eat pizza then....... yah there's more! server" Desert?  The strawberry cheescake is awesome." me: "Oh you had that? server.....wait for it ....wait for it............... "my sister is lactose intolerant and she eats this and then goes to the bathroom......." EEEEEEEERRRRRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTT hand up from me... ok like really?  REALLY??????!!!!!!!!!!! I complained, the douche's boss gave us a free try at it again....hell to the NIZO! but thanks!  you all suck!

Okay, so it's a corporate hell hole in the middle of Hollywood which is going from sleazy dump to corporate distopia. That being said, I still like pizza. Soooo...... Service was fast and friendly for people who seem to hate their jobs (I personally couldn't do serving again, especially here in LA). They put up a really good face in spite of the horrors they must be subjected to by their clientele.  The jerk pizza is yum yum in my tum tum along with the spinach and artichoke dip. But the best part? If you aren't a drinker their selection of non-alcoholic beverages is shockingly wonderful!

I There was 5 of us eating here.  Service was very slow.  We waited over 25 minutes before we got our appetizers and at the same time my grandson got his main course.  We did not get refills on our drinks.  I would not recommend this place.  I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because the food was good.  I gave the waitress my credit card to pay for the check and when she came back with the credit card slip I noticed she did not give me back my card.  My daughter went to the waitress to ask for the card back she pulled it out of her back pocket.  I don't know if it was an honest mistake but I thought it was weird.

I am not a CPK fan. We went and ate up at the bar. The lettuce wraps with chicken and jambalaya were both great, and beautifully presented. The manager was very knowledgeable regarding wine pairings, and made some lovely suggestions. Now for the very best part: THE STAFF. Cameron has a winning personality, a knowledge of food and a true love of people. We had a wonderful time with both he and Raccoon. (Yes, it actually says that on his name tag). I now a huge fan of the Hollywood/Highland CPK, and of Cameron!

CPK is okay, but trying to do catering from this location is a mess.  We needed our order in our office by 12:30p and CPK said they would have it by noon.  They did not get it down to our runner until 12:40p and even then they were missing a pizza.  He did not leave until 12:50p!   It may be a bit farther but the Beverly Center location seems to have it together a bit more than Hollywood & Highland.   Do not try catering from here.

*sigh* Once again, I was feeling the need for a delicious chinese chicken salad from CPK after stopping at the post office to take care of a few things. Well, I phone it in, an easy process.  I picked it up, an easy process.  I opened it at my desk.... Uh.... This is your half chinese chicken salad? This is even LESS than what you normally put in a to-go container for a half-salad (which is already way less than the standard plated half-salad). As a matter of fact, this salad is missing a lot of the color it usually has and has even LESS chicken than it usually does. Furthermore, some of this cabbage is looking a little brown.  I am SO bummed. And I am SO glad I didn't ask for extra chicken, because I would've probably been ripped off with receiving this same standard amount. Ugh. It looks terrible. Just... terrible. Thanks a lot, CPK. Should've ordered Bossa Nova for delivery.
5 stars all the way. The food was great and the service was good. This location is fun because of the Kodak Theater, the shopping and all the lights. Again, As good as it gets!

What a great experienced girlfriend and I had eating out!  Great food and awesome customer service.  We were served by A.C and occasionally another waiter Art came and refilled our drinks (personally I think it was an excuse for him to chat with us).  Love good customer service!!  Great recommendations from AC and super pizza!!  My favorite would have to be the clam pasta dish. Yummy yummy yummy!! Plus we had the tai salad and instead of meat we subbed for avocado... Yummy yummy yummy! Looking forward to my next meal there.  Patio seating is great too when there are heaters blasting.  Great Hollywood and Highland experience.

I'm giving it a 4 instead of a 3 because my pizza was the only thing that was a 3.  I had the veggie and it was a bit too mooshy for me and just wasn't crazy about it.  Anyways the reason why it gets a 4 is the fried mac and cheese, the four seasons pizza that the hubs got which was very delish on the thin crust and the warm butter cake with vanilla ice cream.   The service was pretty good for your typical chain restaurant considering it's in a pretty busy touristy place!!

I'm going to give them five stars even though we had to wait for 45 minutes for a table. They get five stars because they brought us a free pizza because they were sorry we had to wait so long. The place wasn't that crowded, but I was with a big group and the staff still wasn't able to get us a table. But all was forgiven with the pizza guilt offering.  The pizza was delicious as was the rest of the meal.

I have been to a few CPKs and have had mixed experiences. The restaurant at Hollywood & Highland is the best in LA by far. The service is consistently good. The food is always hot, fresh and tasty. Plus it's conveniently located so I can do a little shopping, catch a movie or run some errands before or after my meal.  The only down side is that it can get crowded at this location. Being inside the H&H plaza this should come at no surprise. If you are willing to wait you shouldn't be disappointed. They also have curbside pickup.

Would give it a higher rating, but I hate it when the server puts a large party gratuity on a check (keep in mind we only had 5 in our group) and doesn't tell you.  I can't stand dishonesty.  The food was good though as always.  This is for the establishment in downtown Hollywood at the H&H mall area.

The first time I went to that CPK the waitress, Bethany, was great. She took great care of us, was fast and polite. The second time we went there, they told us that our waitress was starting at 6pm (it was 5:55) but they would send someone else to get our drinks. The same waitress got our drinks and our order and then she disappeared. Someone else brought us our pizza and I saw her going around the restaurant, but not once to our table. She actually left us with two pepper shakers but no cheese.  Then later, another waitress came with the check, but we wanted to see the dessert's menu. Disappointed with the service, we changed our mind and just left. That place wasn't even that full when we got there, we had no idea who was serving us and even though the manager was around, she didn't even acknowledge the ocurrence. I will never go to that place again.

My sister works at a CPK in Denver, and she hooks me up with food cards (thanks J! 8^) ). When Miss M. and I are out seeing a movie or whatever, it's nice to have a CPK nearby to get a discount meal that's pretty damn decent. In general, I really think that CPK has great salads, and pastas.  Their pizzas are pretty good but I don't care for the crust and I usually get my pizza Neapolitan style because I really prefer a thinner crust.  Nothing wrong with their signature pizzas, just my opinion. My biggest advice to anyone going to a CPK is that you don't have to get what they have on the menu.  If you see ingredients in other menu items that you like, put together your own thing!  I do it all the time and they don't mind doing it for you. Anyway, this CPK is pretty much in a tourist spot, but it's a great place to get dinner if you're seeing a movie at the Chinese or ElCapitan.  It's also great to have a Starbucks next door and Beard Papa's just down the way.  (That would be a really great evening: Movie [or whatever] CPK, Starbucks for coffee, then Beard Papa's for a cream puff to go with your coffee). I admire CPK for generally having a good staff.  They are usually friendly and nice.  Another recommendation, if there is a wait list for a table, eat at the counter!  You get to watch them make food, drinks, and you will have more interaction with the servers which I think makes their working time a bit more enjoyable. Food this night was good.  Cobb salad with beets!  Miss M is vegan but gets the Moroccan Chicken Salad without the chicken or egg.  A happy Miss M is a happy me. Besides, there's a dude there who's name is Raccoon.

location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Even though I frequent most of the Bay Area locations I'm reviewing this one mainly because the server seemed surprised I wanted the bigger portioned sized salad.  "Lunch portion?" he asked..."Uh no...give me the big sized.  I'm starving," me.   Yeah, I know I'm in Hollywood.  Home of botox, more plastic surgery than you can imagine and Scientology.  Heaven forbid, you run into a girl with an actual appetite in this town.  It's because I'm not from this town, thank God for that too. The food was good like all the CPK's.  Sitting in traffic makes people like me hungry.  Service was decent...yadda yadda yadda.

The food is OK but healthwise this place is a disaster. Every single item on their menu is truly high in sodium, even the salads. I forgot what I had, but I assure you it was the low-sodium item.  The sicilian pan pizza is tasty, but has over 3000 mg of sodium. Stay away if you care about your health, else come stuff your face. Waitstaff is well trained and polite. Nice touch.

Food was what you'd expect at a national chain. Went here because it was adjacent to the hotel, and I was too tired to have my friends meet me to go anywhere else.   Had the Tequila Pasta, which was yummy. Service was very, very friendly, our waiter was quite handsome, we had a 20 minute wait at 8:30p on a Friday night, but it went by quickly. LOTS of tourists here.

I had the Cesar salad...it tasted like a Cesar salad.  Brother had two soups in a bowl.  It was his usual.  Food is on the pricier side.  Thai chicken pizza was good but not superb.  They are consistent in quality.

Ive probably ate every pizza place within a mile radius on hollywood blvd and CPK always tops the cake.  This is probably the most enjoyable pizza.  Hollywood eaters this place is good.  The outside patio is a great place to sit as well.

First time at CPK, not too bad. Me and my family were on vacation, and we got hungry after a long car trip. So, we decided, let's try CPK for the first time. It's really just so-so. They have a wide variety of pizzas, and some sound quite exotic. We ordered 2 pizzas, since we have amazingly small appetites.  Italian Tomato and Basil, Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage. Nothing special.  Personally, the tomatoes? Kind of mushy and bland. Not ripe and juicy like the kind in taco salads even. Overall, the taste was okay, nothing special or mouthwatering. I liked how they had outdoor seating with heating though, it was quite enjoyable. Service was friendly enough, a tad slower than prefered. But maybe that's because we're used to quick and snappy Chinese restaurants, being a Chinese American. It's quite pricy though! 10 dollars and over for a small pizza, I would've prefered it to be maybe 8 dollars.

My family & I stopped by to eat lunch. My mom had the onion focaccia bread with grilled veggies without cheese. The grilled veggies were very flavorful.  My dad & I had the California chicken lettuce pizza.  The crust was light. The lettuce tasted fresh. There also was a couple slices of bacon which added more flavor. Service: excellent. The waitress talked to us explained the orders. Ambiance: spacious &  clean bathrooms.

Can't afford the Grill or Koji's all the way up there.  I guess we gotta stay down at the first level with all the common folk and go find a...CPK!  Heck yes!   6 words that can ruin your dinner: "Sorry, we don't have bread today."  *disastrous crashing sound effect* Aiya, that's not how I roll (pun unintended).  Granted, I don't know who in the world actually enjoys consuming their cold slices of grocery store loaves but it's a superior alternative to an order of overpriced appetizers when your stomach is growling.   The rest of the meal went by with lagging but courteous service, absolutely savory marsala pasta with chicken and refillable strawberry italian soda.  I forgave the server for the bread thing since he was really nice and I didn't feel the raging hunger from before.  He even ran out after us to give us our validation which my friend accidentally left behind.  What a great finish to a surreal day.

Have not been in Hollywood in quite a while. I finally drove here last Sunday braving the torrential rains and not to mention the embarrassingly flooded streets of Hollywood Boulevard to see my former choir friends of years ago. Been to numerous CPKs but I really enjoyed this branch because of the friendly service. It did not take long for us to get seated and the service was quick. We were out of there in no time. I ordered the garlic cream fettuccine and opted for the chicken which is to my satisfaction. The only rant I have are the servings. My order appeared like I ordered from the kids menu! They could have been more generous. I thought parking would be nightmare in this area which is usually the case in Hollywood but I highly recommend parking at the Kodak theatre parking structure which is the easier route. Paid $4.00 with validation for about 3.5 hours.

Long wait. I don't really like any of the pizza's there. The salads are pretty good and I really enjoy the Spring Rolls (baja chicken). When I go there with my friends all I buy is the baja chicken spring rolls and if I want some more I go to the kids menu because I think they have more of a selection then the grown ups.  Strawberry lemonade and kiwi lemonade is the BOMB!!!

It seems like I always come to this location when its so late that all the places I really want to go, are closed.  (I spend too long in Amoeba usually) I like a few dishes that CPK serves, but overall, meh. The reason this location gets 5 stars is I've showed up within a minute of their "closing time" at least 5 times and they still let me in.  I usually spend a solid hour eating, talking and drinking with my friends.  Its sad, though, to see tourists turned away when they take their family to eat (and seeing a full, lively restaurant) that they are just too late to get in to. I'd also like to mention a handful of great servers I've had.  They are crazy busy yet so nice.  I really appreciate that.  Totally forgetful but I'd be too.  One of them even helped me with my Halloween costume shopping last year.  They recommended this local shop and it had just what I wanted.  Small town vibe in Hollywood - rare from what I've seen. If you are vacationing and doing the whole Walk of Fame/Chinese Theater thing, this is good when you don't know where to eat.  Don't hesitate to look around the top floor of this structure, though.
Can't go wrong with fettuccini...gotta lovevthis plate...
Great pizza, pasta, and friendly service!  They lose a star only because everytime I get their bread, it's stale!  :( However, i think I will continue to frequent CPK and work my way down their menu!

For having a place where you make the easiest thing, they sure do cost a lot. The food is good, but not as good for the price. Insane, service was slow, and busboys acted as they didn't know what they were doing

The very first CPK I've ever been to. This one gets 3 stars for actually being in Hollywood & Highland so this is primarily where I take "visitors/toursits" during the year and if they're up for CPK, then there it is! I've never had any problems with the service but due to the location, the wait may be long, which sucks. Anyway, I find myself ordering the same thing every time... Carne Asada pizza.... with extra spicy sauce... yumm! However, this isn't a place that really pops into my mind as a place I'd choose first to go eat unless I was craving something specific from the menu.

Great view, great food, great waiter, but NO BREAD! This CPK has indoor and outdoor seating. I tend to sit indoors because you tend to be a tourist target for pictures and what not when you sit outside. Moving on, I have rarely had to wait. The seating host/hostess is very prompt in where he will sit you. The seating arrangement is such that big groups tend to sit in the same vicinity where small couples and what not can sit in a more private area. This certain location is the only CPK I have been to that doesn't give out bread. However, the time between order and delivery as well as the quality of the food more than make up for the lack of bread. I've gone to this specific CPK around 4 times (almost every two months). Overall, the quality, service, and food has remained constant. The prices have slightly increased. But, you would expect such from a Pepsi establishment (yes, Pepsi owns CPK).

This time I went to a CPK, I decided to try out a pasta dish. So, of course, I picked the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. It was a'ight. My pasta was more than just al dente - it was hard and chewy. The flavor was ok, but it wasn't my jam. Service was friendly. Overall, it was nothing special. Sorry, CPK.

After touring around Hollywood, my friend and I decided to eat here for brunch. Quickly we were seated outside, which we enjoyed the lovely weather of LA. Not sure what to order, the waitress gave us enough time to think and recommended some food in the menu. Finally we went and ordered the Crispy Mac n Cheese, the Shrimp Dynamite and the Chicken Milanese. Their Crispy Mac n Cheese, was to die for., it was really good! The Shrimp Dynamite was delicious which reminds me of the walnut shrimp but even better... Lastly the Chicken Milanese, at first we thought we ordered pasta, but I guess it wasn't. Once we saw it we thought they gave us the wrong food, but the waitress asked if we wanted to order something different, but we decided to stick with the chicken milanese.. Which turned out to be good too...Their service was good & their food is great! I'll be checking out the SF location!

Sorry, instead of Mickey Mouse ears at the end of this ride, you get pizza.  Trust me, though, it's just as much fun.  For your own safety, please keep your arms and legs inside the ride at all times. First, we venture up the infamous Hollywood Boulevard to the Kodak Theater complex.  Along the way, observe some interesting characters milling around and plenty of tourists either looking completely lost or taking pictures. Keep moving up the stairs of the complex, being careful of the tourists that suddenly stop in front of you to take a dozen pictures.  There will be a slight delay at the top due to more tourists taking pictures, particularly of the Hollywood sign off in the distance. Finally, as we arrive at CPK, be wary of the servers that have been mistreated and tipped very poorly all day.  At your final destination, be prepared to wait a long time for a table.  The pizza will be OK, but nothing spectacular.  At this CPK, it's all about location, location, location. Your vantage point, should you choose to sit outside, which I highly recommend, provides one of the best people-watching spots ever.  Many people seem to believe that this is the best place to go if you want to be discovered, and dress and act accordingly.  Now, that's entertainment!

ok first off, I love CPK. This location is not the best because its a huge tourist spot, and it can get really crowded, which means the servers might be overwhelmed at times, but i'm not concerning myself with that really (there is another CPK really close on sunset and... crescent heights it think?) I don't like pizza (i'm talking nasty pizza hut/ dominoes) but I LOVE CPK pizza, and their pasts, and i LOVE LOVE their salads, and i have never tried, but the sandwiches sound really good too. Great Food, Interesting types of pizza, clean, cool decor, friendly service, reasonably priced.  There is no other restaurant like CPK. If you've never been, give it a try. Very unique! Who else puts lettuce on pizza? great idea!!

Good location right in Hollywood & Highland and does have outdoor seating to enjoy the nice weather and people watch. It is on the smaller side compared to other CPKs in the area.  The menu and prices are typical CPK, so nothing exciting there. The service is good - haven't seen a wait for a table (unless you specify outside) and the waiter seemed to be a little theatrical and over the top (starving actor in Hollywood? What a cliche). He got a partial of the order wrong - we only ordered two items - but he was gracious when we sent it back for the salad that we ordered.

We came here to grab a drink before heading to the airport because I am a horrible flyer and booze helps.  We got seated fast and ended up sitting outside with a great "view" of the tourists taking pictures of the hollywood sign.  We ordered our drinks and in no time they arrived.  I got the Caribbean Sunset Sangria and it was wonderful. Nice size and fruit on the top.  The service was nice and good speed for being such a tourist spot.
CPK was a little disappointing. Service was extremely slow and the food was just okay. Was hoping it would be a little more original. Would not recommend the tortilla soup.

Blegggh. Ever since eating that ill-fated pizza back at the HB CPK, I've vowed never to eat here again - at any of the locations, ever. But I have to admit, even going in here and drinking water and chopping up sugar packets, the staff was nice and the food looked good even though a little greasy (which reminded me, blegh, of that pizza...) It's conveniently close to the metro and a lot of shops, so if you're in the mood for the sell-out's commercialized pizza, here you go! I know someone who really digs their vegan sandwiches here and otherwise, you'll be really hard pressed to find any diet-friendly.
chipolte chicken pizza and pink salmon are the best

DIRTY! I like CPK, I loved the Waldorf Chicken Salad.  I used to describe it as "Bursting with Flavor", but now, it will never be the same. I had lunch today at the CPK Hollywood & Highland. I got my usual salad and I was munching away and having good conversations with my co workers. Then I saw it, a hair. This piece of hair was about .5 Inches long, I could see the follicle white ball thats on the end of it. Gross a rooney! So I push that lettuce aside so I wouldnt look at it anymore. Continue to play cool and drink my soda. Then I saw another one, and another, then another! I moved lettuce after lettuce and there were about 5-6 hair strands in there. It looked like hair from someones hairy arms or hairy chest. Needless to say I am traumatized by this ordeal. If I see a hairy arm or chest I think Im going to heave. I dont wanna think about how many pieces of hair I did eat! Yak Yak Yak! Happy Eatings! :o/

Hollywood and Highland CPK!  Okay, it's always crowded, I always have to wait for a table there, yet it seems I've eaten there more than once, more than twice, more than 3 times... I've eaten there numerous times, so it must obviously be an okay place to go... or it could be the fact that there really isn't anywhere else to go in the Hollywood and Highland complex. I don't know, I like the place alright, and last night I really enjoyed the seasonal beer, and the waitress was really awesome. I'm going to keep this place at 4 stars...
Excellent pizza, but I think they are really small for the price you pay, even for specialty pizza.

Dear CPK,  What the hell happened to you? You used to be my pride and joy, the one reason I'd want to come home over the college holidays, the only motivation for those long cold drives to Boston, the one chain I was ready to name my firstborn child after, the only food that could make any day better....  But now you had to go and ruin it. Forever. I don't think I could ever forgive you. The cheesy waitresses with nametags? Okay. The bad music? Fine. The garish yellow, black and white color scheme? Sure.  BUT TO TAKE AWAY MY ROSEMARY CHICKEN POTATO PIZZA???? AFTER HOW MANY LOYAL YEARS?? You don't understand. You just made the biggest mistake in your corporate history. That was EVERYONE'S favorite pizza. Even the waitress last night told me so. Who else puts potatoes on their sweet pizza dough with a delicious lemony-sauce? NO ONE ELSE. And now you had to go and take it away. I tried your garlic chicken pizza last night. Nope. No good. ONE STAR.  This relationship is O-V-E-R.  Sincerely, Moye

What are chain restaurants good for except the cookie cutter experience of duplicating your fav meal no matter if you're dining in Hollywood, CA or Snohomish, WA? CPK can crank out kung pao pasta or Jamaican Jerk chicken pizza like it was made in that Star Trek facsimilator that could produce any food or beverage you desired a hundred times over with equal consistency.  So, if you've been to a CPK, you know all about the food they have. Boring.  Not the food, the rehashing of each menu item. What's unique about this CPK located in the Hollywood Highland complex, gateway'd by two, 4 story tall,  Cecil B. DeMille elephant statuary is that the service is a drip. Staff is friendly enough usually but they don't understand the fundamentals of basic table service.  - Bring out bread with water shortly after being seated and not never or only when you ask or every other table. - Refill water glasses more than just once please. - For a table of 20+ spending over $500+, don't just assign one waitperson just because it's technically a "single table." Or if you insist one one waitperson, she/he better have a big red, Marvel Comic "S" hiding beneath their mild mannered attire.  - Finally, please ask us for dessert or coffee. Getting the bill instead is kinda like saying "No, we don't want any more of your stinkin money nor do I care about increasing my tip any further. Just get out!"  So, 1 star for service and 1 star for the elephants.
